jobDescription: A boutique data science consultancy, specialising in providing expertise in technology-driven business transformation, is now looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join their team based in London.The company is expanding their team and are looking for a senior data scientist who is driven, passionate and able to develop innovative and effective approaches to solve their clients' most critical business and analytics challenges. T...
fullDescription:
A boutique data science consultancy, specialising in providing expertise in technology-driven business transformation, is now looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join their team based in London.

The company is expanding their team and are looking for a senior data scientist who is driven, passionate and able to develop innovative and effective approaches to solve their clients' most critical business and analytics challenges. The ideal candidate will possess a background in computer science, natural sciences, mathematics or similar. They are looking for individuals that thrive in cross-functional teams and are eager to share their knowledge and learn from others.

The company engages with their clients to serve as a catalyst pushing their abilities to apply Data Science and Data Engineering in production settings. As such, they offer a varied working environment with exciting and challenging projects that ensure continuous opportunities to develop and progress.

Most of their work is onsite with one of their clients in London or Southeast England, with travel to other parts of the UK as necessary. The company will cover any travel and accommodation costs.

With the current situation involving Covid-19, this role may start as remote before moving on to client sites.

About the Company

The company is a boutique data science consultancy specialising in providing expertise in technology-driven business transformation and advanced analytics R&D to solve their clients' most complex business problems, principally in the life sciences, retail/consumer, public sector and financial industries.

They pride themselves on the quality of technical and science talent they have. They value their developers as people as well as employees. They also offer a very attractive benefits package including 24 days annual leave, private health care, dental treatment, discounted gym membership & private pension.

The company is an equal opportunities employer and values diversity. They do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Key Responsibilities:

Statistics and Machine Learning:

  • Conduct exploratory analytics by designing experiments and testing hypotheses on data
  • Write scripts for feature engineering and creation of data assets
  • Develop supervised and unsupervised machine learning models on diverse datasets across structured and unstructured data
  • Design and build models using algorithms appropriate to data volume, type, quality and velocity
  • Perform model validation and hyper-parameter optimisation


Project Management:

Project ownership - responsible for key aspects of projects, including identifying business needs and determining tools, data and techniques to address it
Rapid prototyping and agile development techniques

Communications:

  • Creation of engaging visualisations to communicate key findings to both technical and business-focused clients
  • Presenting and depicting the rationale of findings in simple, engaging and easy to understand business terms to a diverse group of stakeholders
  • Communicating with, coordinating and supporting, business experts
  • Mentoring junior data scientists via the creation of personal development plans, encouraging team-wide diffusion of knowledge and being a source of analytical best practice


Key Requirements:

Technical Skills - Essential:

  • Machine learning algorithms, predictive analytics and statistical techniques (e.g. H20.ai, Tensorflow, Torch, Keras, Caffe, Mahout, Theano, Xgboost, Adaboost libraries)
  • High-level programming language(s) (preferably Python, Scala, Java, C, C++)
  • Statistics and quantitative analytics, forecasting, multivariate testing, and optimization algorithms (e.g. R, Python numerical stack - Pandas, Scipy, Numpy, Jupyter, Numba, Dask, Seaborn, Bokeh, Matplotlib)
  • Understanding of dimensionality reduction and ensemble learning techniques.
  • SQL, NoSQL and MPP databases (Maria, MySQL, Teradata, HBase, MongoDB, Neo4j, Dynamo, Couchbase)
  • Experience with reporting and visualisation technologies
  • Experience bringing Data Science solutions to production
  • Experience working in cloud (preferably AWS)
  • Good working understanding of systems, SCM and virtualisation (Docker, Git, Linux/bash)


Technical Skills - Desirable:

  • Background in Computer Science or experience in Software Engineering
  • Domain-specific knowledge in natural language processing, computer vision, image recognition, speech recognition, anomaly detection or time-series data (e.g. OpenCV, CMU Sphinx, gensim, spaCy, SpeechRecognition libraries)
  • CI/CD and the DevOps toolchain (e.g. Kubernetes, Jenkins, Ansible, Puppet, Maven, Gradle, Vagrant)
  • Front end and API development (e.g. Flask, Django, Tkinter, Swing, AWT)
  • Search tools (e.g. Lucene/Elasticsearch)


Project & Leadership Skills:

  • Agile project/product development
  • Project ownership and task prioritisation
  • Understanding business needs
  • Developing, applying and business cases for a wide variety of stakeholders
  • Presenting technical topics and business cases to stakeholders and co-workers
  • Team leadership


Sounds interesting? Click APPLY to send your CV for immediate consideration.

Candidates with previous experience or job titles including; Data Scientist, Research Data Scientist, Statistics, Automated Machine Learning, Data Scientist Researcher, Python may also be considered for this role.

  • Develop recommender systems using reinforcement learning and Python

Key Skills & Requirements

jobTitle: Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer - Martech Start Up
jobDescription: Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer ** Martech Start Up ** SALARY -            £50k - £65k & equity LOCATION -        Remote to begin with, then Central London Following steady growth over the last 5 years, this martech start up...
fullDescription:
Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer

** Martech Start Up **

SALARY -            £50k - £65k & equity

LOCATION -        Remote to begin with, then Central London

Following steady growth over the last 5 years, this martech start up are looking to expand their growing Tech Team.

Their digital advertising optimisation product, sees them partnering with large organisations, tech providers and other agencies to deliver AI and machine learning optimised advertising performance and engagement; looking in detail at customer behaviour, engagement and conversion.

We are looking for a bit of a hybrid, someone who can easily go between the data science and software engineering team, with skills in both camps. This is essentially an R&D role, where you can flex your creative side in solving real world product problems and adding value through actionable insights and recommendations. You will take the lead on greenfield research projects employing a range of techniques including NLP (Natural language Processing) and Computer Vision (especially video analysis), as well as deploying production ready machine learning pipelines.

You will be joining a cross functional tech team of Data Scientists, Engineers and Software Developers, which they plan to expand over next year, so there is plenty of room for growth and development.

Working closely with the CTO, you will deliver data science solutions and services for their digital advertising optimisation product. They use every bit of available relevant data from their clients to help predict which ads will or won’t do well to enable commercially valuable forecasting and audience insight.

Experience across specialisms such as NLP, sentiment analysis, text mining and AI is required as well as very strong coding and programming skills in machine learning (using Python). Their USP is their creative use of AI to improve each advert for their clients so the variety of projects and work you will gain exposure to is broad, meaning your learning curve could be steep – and joining at middleweight level, you could soon be operating at senior level within a year or two.

Culture is something that is the lifeblood of this agency and something their CEO takes very seriously. They love people from non-traditional backgrounds, and are a very diverse bunch, working hard to ensure they embrace all ethnicities, genders, age groups and disabilities.

Skills and experience required:

  • Educated to at least degree level in a numerate subject; Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Physics, Chemistry, Economics, Machine Learning, Computer Science etc.
  • A strong background in data science techniques as well as coding using Python
  • Experience using a wide range of machine learning techniques, but definitely including NLP and Computer Vision.
  • Ideally industry experience in marketing or advertising
  • A problem solving approach, ability to apply AI and ML techniques to real world business challenges
  • A curious nature, and inquisitive nature plus an ability to build strong relationships with co-workers, peers and senior level stakeholders

fullDescription:
Data Scientist with a background in computer vision technology is sought by a tech innovation company based in Oxford.

With a rich pedigree of delivering tracking and visualization software for an international client base this Data Scientist will join a newly formed R&D project team tasked with utilising the latest in deep learning and networking technologies to deliver technical road mapping for new products.

This Data Scientist should have most of the following key skills:

- Academic or commercial experience working on human tracking projects (ideally using machine learning technologies such as TensorFlow, Keras, Pandas etc) at a PhD or post-doctoral level
- Strong software engineering background - C++, Python, Elixir etc
- Demonstrable experience using deep learning techniques
- Deep networking design and tuning

This Data Scientist will receive:

- Starting salary of £75,000 - £80,000 DoE
- Flexible working hours
- work from home for 2-3 days a week
- Extensive career progression opportunities
- 25 days holiday
- Collaborative, forward thinking working environment
- Free parking

So if you are a Data Scientist who likes the sound of joining a R&D driven, highly collaborative team to work on cutting edge projects with international importance please apply now to be considered and for further information.

Data Scientist
£75, 000 - £80,000 plus remote working
Deep Learning, machine learning, PyTorch, Python, C++

SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST

£35,000-£60,000 + BENEFITS

LONDON

This is an excellent opportunity to work in a leading customer analytics company who own one of the most efficient Data Science and Consultancy functions. As a Senior Data Scientist, you will be working to break down and analyse clients FMCG / retail customer data using a tech stack that is based around Python/PySpark and SQL.

THE COMPANY

As a Senior Data Scientist in this company, you will get to work with some massive clients within the FMCG / retail sectors using advanced modelling to understand their customer base. This is an opportunity to work amongst talented individuals across a wide range of projects in a fast-paced environment.

THE ROLE

As a Senior Data Scientist, you will be working with leading retailers in the FMCG / retail sector as they aim to improve their knowledge and understanding of their customer base. You will be using advanced modelling techniques such as regression, propensity, churn and chaid analysis using a tech stack based around Python/PySpark and SQL.

You will be working on a consultancy basis, using statistical modelling to solve client's problems using your excellent problem-solving skills. As well as this, you will be using advanced technology to increase clients understanding of their customers.

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

The successful Senior Data Scientist will have the following skills and experience:

  • Experience working with Customer Data and statistical modelling
  • Advanced commercial experience using SQL, Python/PySpark and Hadoop
  • Commercial experience within the FMCG / Retail industry is desirable
  • Excellent communicational skills
  • Experience working in a consultancy environment is desirable
  • Educated to degree level in a STEM subject or similar

THE BENEFITS

The successful Senior Data Scientist will receive a salary between £35,000 and £60,000. In addition to this, they shall receive an extensive benefits package, including your birthday off, early Friday finishes, bonus and options to negotiate on flexi-working.

HOW TO APPLY:

Please register your interest by sending your CV to Dylan Butcher via the Apply link on this page.

fullDescription:
Data Scientist

London / Fintech

£75,000

OVERVIEW

The Harnham Data Science team are currently working with a fintech company based in London who have achieved notable success in recent years and have won numerous awards for their market-leading product!

They have scaled up their data capability over the last 2 years (including building out a brand new Data Science and machine learning team) and this position will become a part of that growth and success!

You will be working within a talented team of Data Scientists, Software Engineers, Data Engineers and Product Managers, responsible for utilising your knowledge of statistics/machine learning to solve problems in credit risk, digital and fraud.

There is a great culture here, particularly if you are keen to work in a learning environment.

THE ROLE

On a daily basis you will be:

  • Dedicated to building a new product offerings for the company
  • Experimenting with large datasets, formulating hypotheses and using your statistical/machine learning knowledge to generate insights
  • Using a variety of the latest tools and technologies (Python/Spark)
  • Exploring the use of deep learning techniques on complex problems

SKILLS AND EXPERTISE

You must have:

  • A proven experience in programming with Python
  • An MSc or Ph.D. in a quantitative discipline (e.g. Maths, Stats, Computer Science, Physics etc)
  • Knowledge of a database query language (SQL/Hive preferred)

SALARY

In this role you could earn up to £75,000 + benefits.

HOW TO APPLY

To be considered for this exciting opportunity, please submit your details using the Apply button on this page. Or for more information regarding other roles please contact Nick Mandella at Harnham.

KEYWORDS

Python, Spark, SQL, machine learning, statistics, statistical analysis, Data Scientist, Data Science, Deep Learning.

jobDescription: Fixed Term Contract  We're currently seeking Data Scientists based in and around Leamington Spa with experienced of processing large scientific data sets to work within a state of the art, high output diagnostics laboratory environment as part of the UK's NHS Test and Trace  programme. As well as playing a vital role in supporting society's return to a more normal way of life by helping to break the chains of C...
fullDescription:
Fixed Term Contract

We're currently seeking Data Scientists based in and around Leamington Spa with experienced of processing large scientific data sets to work within a state of the art, high output diagnostics laboratory environment as part of the UK's NHS Test and Trace programme.

As well as playing a vital role in supporting society's return to a more normal way of life by helping to break the chains of COVID-19 transmission, you will also gain invaluable experience and exposure to some of the country's most highly skilled individuals in the scientific community.

This represents a once in a lifetime opportunity to go above and beyond to support public health, while also extending your already accomplished scientific data skills and positioning your career for further success and growth.

If of interest and you meet the criteria of the below, please apply via the following link - https://34DZEaT.

Your responsibilities:

In the role of Data Scientist, you will be responsible for the analysis of sample data and correct tracking and recording of the analysis in the appropriate LIMS database, to the lab's accreditation standards. You will be expected to process large data sets accurately and to identify anomalous results.

Your priority will be to manage the flow of data out of the laboratories, resulting in correct patient sample reporting. You will also analyse non-clinical data as part of process optimisation and escalate any quality control issues relating to reagent performance to the quality manager.

Your experience:

In order to be successful in the role, you'll need the following education and experience:

Education:

  • BSc Honours degree in a biological science

Experience:

  • Proven track record in processing large scientific data sets accurately
  • Previous experience working with PCR datasets
  • Knowledge of diagnostic test, particularly PCR
  • Previous experience within a laboratory environment
  • Expert use of database and data analysis tools
  • For a Lead role - you will also need experience of line management and have the ability to delegate workloads and work across a remote platform.

In addition, the following experience is also desirable but not mandatory:

Experience

  • Practical experience using or administrating Oracle, MS-SQL and Postgres SQL databases.
  • Experience with Sportfire, R or other visualization and analysis packages.

In return:

As well as a competitive rate of pay (with a 20% uplift applied for night working and end of contract bonus), you'll receive comprehensive training on relevant lab procedures and equipment.

This role will work on a shift pattern and will include day, evening and weekend shifts. Please speak to our team to learn more.

You will also be joining a diverse and hugely welcoming team. Diversity is about reflecting the communities we serve, holding the principles of equality and inclusion at the heart of everything we do and all that we stand for, embracing differences, creating possibilities, and growing together. We aim to foster a culture where individuals of all backgrounds feel confident in bringing their whole selves to work, feel included and their talents are nurtured, empowering them to contribute fully to our purpose.

This is literally a once in a lifetime opportunity to join a team of highly skilled individuals, all focussed on delivering the best possible outcome.

If you're ready for a new challenge and want to be part of the team delivering this essential lab work, please apply today via https://34DZEaT.

jobDescription: Data Scientist  Sports Betting and Casino Remote Competitive package Our client is one of the world’s largest groups within the gambling industry, with annual sales exceeding €3bn, and employing 14,000 people internationally. They operate large scale businesses in both B2B and B2C markets. Within the B2C space, our client  operates an online and r...
fullDescription:
Data Scientist

Sports Betting and Casino

Remote

Competitive package

Our client is one of the world’s largest groups within the gambling industry, with annual sales exceeding €3bn, and employing 14,000 people internationally. They operate large scale businesses in both B2B and B2C markets. Within the B2C space, our client operates an online and retail sports betting business, and also online casino. They are now making some ambitious and forward-thinking strategic changes, meaning they are in a strong position to take advantage of the new regulated market in Germany. As a result, our client is now looking to recruit a talented Data Scientist to join their CRM Team.

Role

  • Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions.
  • Mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques and business strategies.
  • Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques.
  • Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets.
  • Use predictive modeling to increase and optimize customer experiences, revenue generation, ad targeting and other business outcomes.
  • Develop company A/B testing framework and test model quality.
  • Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes.
  • Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy.

Success in this role is likely to lead to further career progression opportunities within the organisation.

Requirements

  • Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SLQ, Matlab, RapidMiner, TensorFlow, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.
  • Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks.
  • Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications.
  • 5-7 years of experience manipulating data sets and building statistical models, has a Master’s or PHD in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or another quantitative field, and is familiar with the following software/tools:
  • Coding knowledge and experience with several languages: C, C++, Java, JavaScript, Scala, Flink etc.
  • Knowledge and experience in statistical and data mining techniques: GLM/Regression, Random Forest, Boosting, Trees, text mining, social network analysis, etc.
  • Experience using web services: Redshift, S3, Spark, DigitalOcean, etc.
  • Experience with distributed data/computing tools: Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Gurobi, MySQL, etc.
  • Experience visualizing/presenting data for stakeholders using: Periscope, Business Objects, D3, ggplot, etc. Experience in e-commerce advantageous
  • Fluent English - a must, German advantageous, other languages also welcomed

Experience in the gambling industry (either sports betting or online casino) is desirable, but not essential. Candidates from FMCG, Retail and Ecommerce would also be of interest. If you have the experience outlined above, please apply today.

fullDescription:
Data Scientist, Data Analyst, Data Visualisation, Python

My client, a rapidly growing organisation within the healthcare industry, is seeking a Data Scientist to join their Research Engineering & team. The successful Data Scientist will work on producing Data Analysis and Data visualisation insights on the algorithmic data for the company’s medical device.

The company is seeking a bright and creative Data Scientist to assist in the build of modular and scalable code, written in Python and its subsequent libraries, NumPy and Pandas for plotting and Data visualisation; in order to demonstrate key trends which will support the Research & Engineering team in the improvement of their algorithms.

The Company

As the Data Scientist, you will be joining this healthcare-based organisation at an exciting time of growth. With a rapid increase in their client base, they are at a pivotal point in business development and as such are in need of new and exciting talent. You will be joining an organisation who values caring, enthusiastic and passionate forward-thinkers who are willing to learn and get stuck-in.

What’s Required?

To be successful within this role the Data Scientist will need to have the following skillset:

  • Experience of Python including NumPy, Brokeh, Matplotlib and similar, either through commercial experience of from a relevant STEM-based MSc degree
  • Ability to operate with Linux on a day-to-day basis
  • Ability to build modular and scalable code
  • Good database experience
  • Experience of Data Visualisation with another programming language is highly beneficial as well as experience of Hadoop, Apache Spark or another similar processing engine

What Next?

This is an excellent opportunity not to be missed. We are seeking someone who is keen to learn and progress in their career. It’s an exciting, progressive company who are looking to invest in the right employee to push the business forward! Apply now for immediate consideration.

Data Scientist, Data Analyst, Data Visualisation, Python, Medical Device, Healthcare, Algorithm, NumPy, Pandas

Corriculo Ltd acts as an employment agency and an employment business.

jobTitle: Data Scientist (DV, SC or BPSS cleared)
jobDescription: Data Scientists needed for a Consultancy specialising in Data Engineering, Data Science and Cloud infrastructure. As a Partner driven organisation they focus on customer success and fostering an excellent internal culture for the team. By doing so it enables  them to implement rapid agile digital transformations across a variety of industry which is further augmented by their accelerators and automation toolsets They believe that thei...
fullDescription:
Data Scientists needed for a Consultancy specialising in Data Engineering, Data Science and Cloud infrastructure. As a Partner driven organisation they focus on customer success and fostering an excellent internal culture for the team. By doing so it enables them to implement rapid agile digital transformations across a variety of industry which is further augmented by their accelerators and automation toolsets

They believe that their people are what has made them the company they are today. They have chosen to adopt a partnership model, ensuring that they all share in the success. With only 4 levels in their hierarchy between consultant and partner, everyone is empowered to have a positive influence in the way we do things.

Please note that a lot of their work is in government, so will require DV or SC clearance or the ability to acquire.

Role & Responsibilities:

  • Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions.
  • Mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques and business strategies.
  • Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques.
  • Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets.
  • Use predictive modelling to increase and optimize customer experiences, revenue generation, ad targeting and other business outcomes.
  • Develop company A/B testing framework and test model quality.
  • Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes.
  • Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy.

Essential Requirements

  • Strong problem solving skills with an emphasis on product development.
  • Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SLQ, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.
  • Experience working with and creating data architectures.
  • Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks.
  • Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams.
  • A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques.
  • They’re looking for someone with ideally 4+ years of experience manipulating data sets and building statistical models, has a Master’s or PHD in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or another quantitative field, and is familiar with the following software/tools:

o Coding knowledge and experience with several languages: C, C++, Java,

o JavaScript, etc.

o Knowledge and experience in statistical and data mining techniques: GLM/Regression, Random Forest, Boosting, Trees, text mining, social network analysis, etc.

o Experience querying databases and using statistical computer languages: R, Python, SLQ, etc.

o Experience using web services: Redshift, S3, Spark, DigitalOcean, etc.

o Experience creating and using advanced machine learning algorithms and statistics: regression, simulation, scenario analysis, modelling, clustering, decision trees, neural networks, etc.

o Experience analyzing data from 3rd party providers: Google Analytics, Site Catalyst, Coremetrics, Adwords, Crimson Hexagon, Facebook Insights, etc.

o Experience with distributed data/computing tools: Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Gurobi, MySQL, etc.

o Experience visualizing/presenting data for stakeholders using: Periscope, Business Objects, D3, ggplot, etc.

jobDescription: DATA SCIENTIST UP TO £55,000 + BENEFITS LONDON This is an excellent opportunity to work in a leading customer analytics company who own one of the most efficient Data Science and Consultancy functions. As a Data Scientist, you will be working to break down and analyse client's customer data using a tech  stack that is based around Python, SQL and Azure. <...
fullDescription:
DATA SCIENTIST

UP TO £55,000 + BENEFITS

LONDON

This is an excellent opportunity to work in a leading customer analytics company who own one of the most efficient Data Science and Consultancy functions. As a Data Scientist, you will be working to break down and analyse client's customer data using a tech stack that is based around Python, SQL and Azure.

THE COMPANY

As a Data Scientist in this company, you will get to work with various using advanced modelling to understand their customer base. This is an opportunity to work amongst talented individuals across a wide range of projects in a fast-paced environment.

THE ROLE

As a Data Scientist, you will be working with industry leading companies as they aim to improve their knowledge and understanding of their customer base. You will be using advanced modelling techniques such as regression, propensity, churn and chaid analysis using a tech stack based around Python, SQL and Azure..

You will be working on a consultancy basis, using statistical modelling to solve client's problems using your excellent problem-solving skills. As well as this, you will be using advanced technology to increase clients understanding of their customers.

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

The successful Data Scientist will have the following skills and experience:

  • Experience working with Customer Data and statistical modelling
  • Advanced commercial experience using SQL, Python/PySpark and Hadoop
  • Excellent communicational skills
  • Experience working with CRM/Digital/Marketing data and associated analytical techniques
  • Experience working in a consultancy environment is desirable
  • Educated to degree level in a STEM subject or similar from a top 5 university

THE BENEFITS

The successful Data Scientist will receive a salary up to £55,000 and an extensive benefits package.

HOW TO APPLY:

Please register your interest by sending your CV to Dylan Butcher via the Apply link on this page.

fullDescription:
My client is start up financial services company based in the heart of Glasgow. They are seeking a Data Scientist who has experience with common data models and within the financial regulatory space.

The salary for this role is between £35,000 - £70,000 depending on experience.

Requirements

  • Minimum two years of experience working as a Data Scientist
  • Experience working in finance industry, particularly within the financial regulatory space
  • Experience with common data models
  • Strong in Python or / and R
  • Proficiency in data mining, mathematics, and statistical analysis
  • Experience with credit risk, risk assessment, Machine Learning, SPSS, SAS, statistical or MI packages would be a bonus

If this role sounds interesting to you, please apply today.

Established in Didsbury, ITECCO has grown to become one of the UK's most successful and fastest growing IT recruitment companies in the UK.

fullDescription:
Data Scientist - Defence

Brief Summary

  • Data Scientist consulting role which requires flexibility for UK based travel when required
  • We are looking for the technical expertise to develop and use statistical models, machine learning techniques, data manipulation methods and programming skills to wrestle data into submission.
  • Key technical skills: Python or R, Spark, TensorFlow, Hive
  • Defence is a major growth sector and seeing massive investment and innovation - This opportunity will be focused on this sector.
  • Existing SC or DV Clearance is required

The organisation

You will be joining a world leader in the business and technology consulting space, which is uniquely positioned to expertly guide their clients through critical change programmes. Drawing on an unrivalled professional network and a rich history of elite consulting, we are committed in our pursuit of offering best in class services.

Our roots in central government bodies are deep and our commitment to the defence sector is unwavering. We are passionate about driving change and innovation throughout the sector.

We collaborate with our clients to understand their unique needs, provide insight and advice to very senior stakeholders and we stay close to our clients well past implementation and benefits realisation.

The role

As per the summary above, you will use your technical expertise in a client led organisation. As such, we're also looking for strong communication and presentation skills as a key part of the role is to help clients to understand the technical and functional implications of your work.

You will strive to understand business challenges and with the power of data, you will uncover valuable insights and strategies.

Requirements

  • Deep data science expertise - You have experience of applying advances analytics to business challenges
  • A strategic and analytical thinker
  • Machine learning methodologies and frameworks such as TensorFlow
  • Strong coding skills in R, Python and/or SAS
  • Experience with Spark, Hive or Impala
  • Passion for the public sector and more specifically, the defence sector.
  • Existing SC or DV clearance
  • Beneficial skills: architecture, cloud, DevOps

Click to apply!

Reference: AMC*SW/SCI3983

Type: Permanent

Location: London

Position: Data Scientist - Defence

Salary: £48,000 - £75,000 + package

Contact: Stephen White

fullDescription:
Recession-proof, shining star in the Manchester FinTech arena - with leading-edge tech, ethics, meritocracy, and real growth. Data and Analytics is at the very heart of everything they do. A growth Business. We saw a >10% increase in staff here during Q2 and Q3 so far this year and this will increase. Benefits include Bonus, Pension, Courses and self-development, food, cerebral colleagues and your chance to genuinely make an impact with cutting edge tech in the biggest projects in the Business.

This role is all about Building a range of toolsets and models to increase the profitability of the organisation, utilising a best in class tech stack.

Requirements:

  • You’ll come from a Data Science background with PhD or strong Masters
  • You’ll have Modelling skills and experience
  • Coding ability - SQL, R, Python - Python preferable
  • Leadership qualities and the ability to develop a Junior Analyst or 2 in time
  • Ideally, Financial Services experience - better = asset valuation

This is a key role in a firm who are currently undergoing exponential growth - it’s an exciting time to join and for the right person could be a real career-maker.

Our client also offers a strong bonus, excellent benefits and an amazing city centre location to work in.

Feel free to call any of the team at PeopleGenius for more info.

Keywords: Data Scientist, Quantitative Analyst, Quant, Quant Data Scientist, Senior Analyst,

fullDescription:
Data Scientist - Manchester

Data Scientist with experience of creating financial models, machine learning, SQL, Python and forecasting experience is required by a leading company in Manchester.

As the Data Scientist, you will be responsible for defining & shaping of all financial modelling and forecasting to enhance decision making, deliver more targeted acquisition, and deliver profitable growth. Tools wise they are using SQL, Python & R, so you should ideally have strong experience in these areas, especially SQL

Any experience of Machine Learning would be a big advantage as this is an area that they want to move into, so something that will huge for them in the coming years

Experience required

  • Proven predictive modelling, forecasting and analytical experience with strong SQL, Python & R skills
  • Some awareness of Machine Learning and the advantages of using machine learning to increase efficiency in the data moving forward
  • Experience with Financial Services is ideal as you need to understand how they operate and what kind of models need to be produced
  • Proficiency in data mining, mathematics, and statistical analysis
  • Able to articulate key messages and analysis outcomes clearly and concisely with a Pragmatic and analytical mind
  • A strong academic record with a good honours degree or equivalent qualification in a numerical subject
  • Extensive experience of completing complex data analysis and create proposals / provide recommendations on the back of analysis
  • Any experience with Credit risk, risk assessment, Python, Machine Learning, SPSS, SAS, statistical or MI packages would be a bonus

This Data Scientist role has lots of autonomy. For example, one project may be to look at risk profiles of customers, create models to forecast to which customers are going to give a better ROI and help define the overall strategy

Data Scientist Responsibilities

  • Responsible for the definition, shaping and ongoing maintenance of all financial modelling and forecasting to enhance decision making, deliver more targeted acquisition and ultimately deliver profitable growth.
  • Undertake specialised analysis to model historical data and provide forecasts based on various industry-related metrics for a range of different propositions.
  • Conduct scenario analysis based on various factors that will help to assess the risk
  • Proactively recommend + implement updates to financial models during periods of change
  • Responsible for reviewing all financial models to arrive at preliminary conclusions and providing good quality and timely financial modelling advice to the business in a way that non-specialists can easily understand and absorb.
  • Champion data quality and integrity, highlighting data quality issues and suggesting appropriate solutions.
  • Share knowledge and experience, and analytical/modelling best practices as well as mentoring and development of team member skills

My client is one of the leading employers in Manchester and they are looking to pay a salary of between £45,000 - £65,000. They offer some great benefits, including a free gym, flexible working, discounted lunches etc. To apply press apply now or send your CV to matthew.leach @ circlerecruitment.com or contact me on LinkedIn

Circle Recruitment is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy. Earn yourself a referral bonus if you refer somebody else who fills the role! We also offer an iPad if you refer a new client to us and we recruit for them. Follow us on Facebook - Circle Recruitment , Twitter - @Circle_Rec and LinkedIn - Circle Recruitment.

What you need to know…  They are a 5-year-old scale-up who now have over 140 people across their 2 sites, Lo...
fullDescription:
Want to work with an award-winning business that builds products that have created huge waves throughout the tech community globally? With 4 products very much under their belt, they are now R&D'ing hard to develop more. With that comes a requirement for a superstar Data Scientist to join their team in Bristol.

What you need to know…

  • They are a 5-year-old scale-up who now have over 140 people across their 2 sites, London and now Bristol.
  • They're looking for someone to have a significant impact on the development and capabilities of the upcoming new and existing products.
  • Prepare yourself for a face-paced environment - twiddling thumbs will be a thing of the past!
  • Daily life will consist of working with your Data Science teammates, developing novel detection algorithms using Machine Learning & Model Signalling techniques
  • You'll play an integral role in new product developments, working closely with the R&D team
  • With both physical and virtual products you'll design, perform and analyse product experiments
  • You'll work in cross-functional teams to drive future development

What you'll be pleased to know…

  • With Covid19 still lurking in the shadows you'll be wondering how stable this company really is. Rest-assured, this company is stronger than ever and due to the 'volatile market-proof' nature of their products, they're growing at a bonkers rate.
  • They have received numerous rounds of funding and have plans to expand across the globe.
  • Alongside expansion comes more opportunity, so progression within the business is certainly on the cards.
  • Flexible working is no issue at all, long term they'd love to see you in the office 2-3 days per week.

What you're probably going to tell all your friends…

  • So, you're working for this awesome business *and* you get brilliant perks???
  • Expect shares in the company, private healthcare, flexible working hours, working from home, discount for family and your friends, personal development allowance, WPA, generous mental well-being subscriptions if you want them, great pension, and more.
  • They've won a truckload of awards; have been spoken about by the BBC, Vogue, etc.
  • Probably the coolest offices in Bristol (in my opinion)!
  • Generally working with some super-intelligent, influential, and down-right amazing people.

What you're going to do next…

If you've got this far then you're probably interested! All you need to do is hit apply and I'll come to you. If you're after some more information, then you can ring me on

jobDescription: Data Scientist - Permanent London About Us  Lloyd’s is the world’s leading insurance and reinsurance marketplace. Yet the world is changing, and Lloyd’s is changing too - nimbler, faster, and able to offer customers and employees more products, services and insights supported by technology, innovation  and the continuing desire to protect people, businesses and communiti...
fullDescription:
Data Scientist - Permanent

London

About Us

Lloyd’s is the world’s leading insurance and reinsurance marketplace. Yet the world is changing, and Lloyd’s is changing too - nimbler, faster, and able to offer customers and employees more products, services and insights supported by technology, innovation and the continuing desire to protect people, businesses and communities. Lloyd’s is where Data Scientists can now bring their future to life.

The Role

The overall objective of the Data Scientist is to analyse the financial performance of Lloyd's at class of business, syndicate and market level, develop predictive statistical models and techniques to better understand performance and lead the implementation of these new models into the Performance Management teams.

Responsibilities

  • Identify and lead opportunities to develop new methods of understanding the key drivers of performance of Lloyd’s business
    • recommend new tools and methods of analysis to senior managers that can improve the divisions understanding of both past and potential future performance and improve the prudential oversight of the Lloyd’s market
    • working across multiple teams as required to create working prototypes and proof of concepts for additional data and or new models that provide meaningful insight into underwriting and financial performance
    • use strategic tools and techniques for delivering these insights to the business teams in Performance Management, Market Reserving and Capital and Risk that may use these new tools
    • working with Digital, IT and Change to manage any projects that are required to implement the data requirements or new models into production
    • launch new data, tools and methods of analysis to the relevant business teams
    • Provide training and support to users of new models and analysis methods to ensure that underwriting performance tools are understood consistently across the relevant user groups
  • Understand the methodologies used in Performance Management for monitoring and predicting performance and support the parameterisation, further development and maintenance with Digital and IT where required E.g. PI pack, Planning Support Tool and On levelling toolset.
  • Provide daily operational support to meet Performance Management data output requirements
  • Support external presentations as appropriate (eg Ratings Agencies).
  • Keeping at the forefront of data analysis, modelling, tools and techniques to ensure that own skills and our methods of modelling and analysis are current and fit for purpose
  • Understanding and keeping abreast of trends and performance issues in the wider insurance industry and macro-economic environment to make sure that Lloyd’s trends are considered and investigated

Skills

  • The role holder will combine the skills of a data analyst, statistician, data modeller and storyteller to extract and communicate insight from data
  • Data modelling skills are required in order to manipulate data and undertake advanced statistical analysis
  • Creative thinking, the ability to analyse, infer solutions, detect patters in data, problem solve and clearly articulate concepts and cogently recommend solutions, evidence of which might include blog posts, publications, participation in open source projects etc.
  • Ability to work with a range of stakeholders to define and shape analytical or modelling requirements and develop and implement solutions to meet business needs.
  • Presentation skills, demonstrating the ability to present the results of complex analytical output to a variety of audiences with different levels of technical knowledge and experience
  • The ability to create reports, queries and dashboards using Business Objects, Qlik and/or similar reporting tools
  • Good time management skills demonstrating an ability to deal with a regular workload and associated deadlines, and other ad-hoc tasks

Knowledge

  • Advanced knowledge, understanding and expertise in statistical and machine learning techniques, e.g. multivariate regression, Bayesian inference / networks and generalized linear models etc.
  • Advanced knowledge of computer software used to manipulate, analyse and visualise large volumes of data
  • Basic to intermediate level knowledge of insurance principles and practices, as well as practices specific to the London/Lloyd’s markets

Experience

  • An expert in the field of statistical and business analysis
  • Expertise with building and querying data sets and statistical software, in particular R and SQL
  • Experience in summarising and conveying complex processes and solution to audiences with varying levels of technical knowledge

Realise your professional ambitions as part of an organisation that is trusted to solve some of the world’s most complex problems in an environment that puts a focus on investing in human progress.

Please be aware that the recruitment process will comprise of a number of steps, your CV will be reviewed by our Recruitment team and if successful you will be invited to attend a telephone interview, followed by a more in-depth video interview. We want to make sure we do all we can to make this a really positive experience for you.

Please click the Clear Talents link on our Workday page which will take you through a simple process to identify any adjustments or additional support we can provide beforehand or on the day.

Please note, clicking on this link does not register your application for the vacancy.

jobDescription: Senior Data Specialist Gibraltar £Excellent Job Duties  Define, build and verify machine learning solutions, optimization engines and statistical models to maximise business valueApply machine learning approaches, advanced statistical and analytical techniques to extract general patterns and insights from data<l...
fullDescription:
Senior Data Specialist

Gibraltar

£Excellent

Job Duties

  • Define, build and verify machine learning solutions, optimization engines and statistical models to maximise business value
  • Apply machine learning approaches, advanced statistical and analytical techniques to extract general patterns and insights from data
  • Understand how advance analytic technique and application can help solve business problems
  • Enhance overall customer behavioural profile and improve Company capability for optimized next best action
  • Chose the best modelling approach for the given business problem
  • Conduct data preparation to integrate data from sources and prepare data ready for modelling and analysis
  • Use advance data manipulation to produce new features that boost model performance
  • Monitoring of live model performance and statistical process control approaches to identify significant performance deviations and need for intervention
  • Develop algorithms that personalise content or automate actions at various customer touch points
  • Develop in-depth product knowledge to understand key drivers of business and customer behaviours
  • Support the Company with key business optimization challenges such as bonus allocation and pricing
  • Develop relationships with key business stakeholders to identify key opportunities for predictive analytics
  • Articulate model characteristics and impact to business stakeholders efficiently, helping them to understand the commercial implications of the data being presented
  • Educate business stakeholders on how to interpret the model outputs
  • Drive analytical projects through to delivery and embed them within the organisation
  • Pilot and test new solutions
  • Work with developers to operationalise and fully automate pieces of analysis
  • Have a good understanding of industry trends and embrace industry innovations on data technology and advanced analytics

Requirements

  • BSC in computer science, mathematics or statistics
  • Excellent problem solving skills
  • Experience of data analytics at a senior level
  • Experience with modelling platforms
  • A balanced set of skills across various domains, including machine learning techniques, data engineering, statistical analytics and tools development
  • Strong understanding of data mining methodology
  • Ability to build relationship with key stakeholders
  • Excellent influencing skills
  • An understanding of business processes within the gaming world
  • Highly data and statistical driven
  • Has experience in rolling out advance data mining models

jobDescription: Job Introduction In this impactfulrole within the Customer Insights team, you’ll be responsible for usingadvanced analytics and data science to enable data-driven decisions across theSociety. You’ll provide thought leadership to a range of stakeholders and beproactive in your approach in order to encourage the right outcomes as a resultof your analysis. You’ll use your experience of the...
fullDescription:
Job Introduction

In this impactful
role within the Customer Insights team, you’ll be responsible for using
advanced analytics and data science to enable data-driven decisions across the
Society. You’ll provide thought leadership to a range of stakeholders and be
proactive in your approach in order to encourage the right outcomes as a result
of your analysis.

You’ll use your experience of the latest data science techniques to
identify opportunities and make recommendations to deliver return on
investment, improved customer engagement and opportunities for process improvement.

Being a senior member of our Customer Insight data
science team means you’ll mentor and support your colleagues to deliver our
data and analytics strategy, so you’ll strike a balance of being hands-on with
data along with being a key contact and role model for your colleagues.

Main Responsibilities

You’ll be responsible for building and maintaining the
models required to drive value and deliver both complex and smaller projects
which deliver commercial value. As well as providing data insights, you’ll also
promote a culture of analytical curiosity by asking the right questions to best
understand and deliver business needs.

You will work closely with leaders across the organisation
and ensure you build and maintain relationships to allow you to present your
analysis in a way which resonates with your audience. Through effective
coaching and mentoring you’ll also support your team and their development.

Ideal Candidate

We’re looking for someone who is highly experienced in a
broad range of data science techniques including machine learning, model cross
validation and time-series analysis. You’ll have experience in using a range of
data analysis tools such as SQL, R or Python and the ability to pass on your
learning and experience to others. The key competencies for this role are:

Experience managing large and complex data sets Significant experience using a range of data
science techniques Proven track record of converting business
problems into analytical solutions Excellent presentation,
communication and influencing skills with the ability to tailor your approach
to suit your audience (including senior management) and present complex ideas
in a simple way Experience of a variety of data visualisation
tools Experience working in a commercially focused
environment

Due to Covid-19 this
role is currently home-based. We have a flexible approach to working and can
consider a range of working patterns as well as candidate preferences around
home/office working.

About Skipton Building Society

At Skipton Building Society we are not just another Financial Services Institution we are a mutual organisation, which means we are owned by our members and believe in placing them at the heart of everything we do. The same goes for our people. We can only be successful as a business if we have great people and we believe in treating people as individuals. Our values are Trust, Ownership and One Team which reflect the attitudes and way of working everyone here displays on a daily basis, and which are key to the delivery of the outstanding level of personal service we offer our customers.

We’re committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace wh
ere every colleague has an opportunity to fulfil their career potential. We respect and appreciate the value that our colleagues’ unique differences can bring and offer consideration for anyone seeking a more flexible work-life balance. If you have a need for flexibility then please let us know.

Why Work For Us

We’re committed to paying
our people fairly for the role they undertake and provide a wide range of
benefits to support our colleagues’ finances and wellbeing, including our
Employee Assistance programme, the opportunity to buy extra holidays and
shopping discount vouchers You’ll be able to shape your career within your team and can expect a
structured learning and development programme where you’ll be valued recognised
and rewarded.

 More information on our benefits can be found here

Skipton are an equal
opportunities employer and we welcome applications from all suitably skilled or
qualified applicants, regardless of their race, sex, disability,
religion/beliefs, sexual orientation or age

fullDescription:
Data Scientist

I am currently looking for a Data Scientist to come and join my client who are embarking upon a technological transformation. The Data Scientist position will play a massive role in this transformation as the data and information will be at the very heart of what they do. I am looking for an experienced Data Scientist who will be able to translate business requirements into well designed, conceptual, logical and physical data modeals and structures. As well as performing the ETL process of data integration between systems.

Key skills for the role:

  • Strong data analysis experience
  • Experience of meta-data management
  • Experience of data quality management
  • Experience of corporate and regulatory compliance
  • Experience of relational data base technologies; e.g. Oracle, SQL Server
  • Experience of relational and multi-dimensional data model design
  • Experience of data mining models and statistical techniques
  • Knowledge of reference data management
  • Knowledge of master data management
  • Knowledge of data life-cycle management
  • Knowledge of using QDI Compose, Replicate and Catalyst
  • Knowledge of data interoperability and Integration frameworks and ETL best practice
  • Knowledge of Ethical Standards Framework
  • Experience of using an ITSM tool
  • Proficient communication skills to bridge the gap between technical and business language to ensure shared understanding and effective solution delivery;
  • A degree, HND or equivalent qualification, and/or have significant relevant experience.

If you believe you are ticking a number of the boxes above and would like to be considered for the role please do apply to the position. Furthermore, if you have any queries you wish to discuss you can reach me on

jobDescription: Lead Data Scientist (Insurance Pricing) We are currently recruiting for a major personal and commercial lines insurer, for a highly experienced Data Scientist, ideally with experience of insurance pricing. This is an exciting opportunity for the successful applicant to assist in the transformation  of the existing pricing analytics team to an effective Data Science function. This will involve leading on the Data Science strateg...
fullDescription:
Lead Data Scientist (Insurance Pricing)

We are currently recruiting for a major personal and commercial lines insurer, for a highly experienced Data Scientist, ideally with experience of insurance pricing. This is an exciting opportunity for the successful applicant to assist in the transformation of the existing pricing analytics team to an effective Data Science function.

This will involve leading on the Data Science strategy, ownership of the delivery of Data Science models for pricing and customer behaviour, upskilling/ training of the existing team, and managing key stakeholder relationships across pricing and the wider business.

The role will serve as a Technical Lead/ Subject Matter Expert (SME) for all things Data Science, leading the team in the delivery of predictive models to improve the insurers competitiveness and profitability.

Essential requirements:

Technically advanced Data Scientist skilled in all areas of predictive modelling (Random Forests, Decision Trees, Regression, GBM's, Neural Networks etc.)

Leadership experience (can be from a training, mentoring, project lead perspective)

Strong, demonstrable Stakeholder Management capabilities to a senior level

Highly collaborative

Please send your CV or contact Alex Williams at Gerrard White Consulting for more details.

THE ROLE  Within this role as a Senior Data Scientist you will be contributing to research meetings and will be invested in generating ideas and presenting them to the team. As ...
fullDescription:
Senior Data Scientist - NLP - Permanent - London

Data Idols are working with a Start-up who are disrupting the health care industry and looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join the team in their London office.

THE ROLE

Within this role as a Senior Data Scientist you will be contributing to research meetings and will be invested in generating ideas and presenting them to the team. As a Senior Data Scientist, you will have a high degree of responsibility and the opportunity to continue growing.

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

  • You must have 5+ years of commercial experience working with deep learning models
  • Able to write Python and a deep learning framework
  • Experience using NLP
  • Knowledgeable of Machine Learning
  • Able to train large scale Deep Learning Models

This is a great opportunity for a Senior Data Scientist to join a very exciting Start-Up on a permanent basis with a great salary and benefits package based in London. For consideration and further details please submit your CV.

Senior Data Scientist - NLP - Permanent - London
