A multi-national engineering company based in Glasgow are looking for an experienced Data Scientist to help them achieve their ambitious vision to transform the industry.

They are currently experiencing a lot of growth and are investing a lot of money into their Tech team. In this role, you will play a crucial part in the company's digitalisation and will be liaising with key internal stakeholders in designing the data roadmap. The Data Scientist will need to make sense of the huge amounts of machine performance data and visualise the findings to the engineers. They have a whole suite of analytical tools available and below is a list of technologies that you will have exposure to. It is not required that you have experience in all of these but it would be beneficial.

  • Strong Python experience
  • Strong analytical skills
  • JavaScript (desirable)
  • Building Machine Learning algorithms
  • SQL
  • Data Visualisation tools e.g. PowerBI, Tableau
  • Experience in delivering IoT projects (desirable)
  • Engineering experience (desirable)

If this role is of interest, please send your CV to or call Adam on for more information.

jobTitle: Data Scientist - eCommerce Analytics - Part Remote

Candidates will have big data / analytics  experience in an online retail / eCommerce setting. Role Info: eCommerce Data Analyst / Data Scientist - eCommerce Books, Media & Tec...
fullDescription:
** Top 10 Global Amazon and eBay 3rd party seller ** We are seeking an intelligent, highly motivated insight analyst, possessing intellectual curiosity and strong problem solving skills to join our Data Insight Team. Candidates will have big data / analytics experience in an online retail / eCommerce setting.

Role Info:

eCommerce Data Analyst / Data Scientist - eCommerce Books, Media & Technology
Covid Remote moving to Home-Based 3 Days / Wallingford, Oxfordshire 2 Days
£35,000 - £50,000 + Benefits

Company profile:

We are a privately owned business, with a core focus on the online retail of books, media and technology products to customers across the globe. Our principle points of sale are marketplaces such as Amazon, eBay etc. where third party suppliers are encouraged to advertise their products and make them available to the customer bases of those brands. In addition to third party marketplaces, the business also operates a number of its own brands/websites,

The company has grown since its inception in 2005 and now employs over 200 staff in three separate countries, shipping 15,000+ items per day to customers across the globe.

The company is globally one of the top 10 largest third party sellers on both Amazon and eBay.

Your Role:

This team is the heartbeat of our business. It is tasked with leveraging the vast amount of data we hold about our products, customers and competitors and using it to perform continual analysis, data mining and trend spotting to improve our product offering, revenue optimisation and customer experience. The right candidate will be excited by the prospect of getting their hands dirty in the collation, refinement and analysis of large volumes of data to produce tangible business strategies which can be implemented quickly in the business.

As a company growing quickly, we are dependent on the insight we glean from our data to provide us with a competitive edge. Candidates will find this a unique opportunity to make a big splash from day one and embark on a career journey with significant future executive level prospects.

The role is focused on two distinct but related brands:

+ A B2C retail brand, focusing mainly on sale of books and media to customers around the globe.
+ A D2C buyback brand which values book/media/tech products and gives consumers redeem them for a cash.

About You:

+ Candidates will have previous experience doing analytical work elsewhere, particularly focused on pricing or revenue optimisation. Data insight roles at comparison shopping portals, price comparison portals, Airlines, FMCG, Retail chains, Digital marketing agencies are all complimentary and would be looked upon favourably.
+ Experience must include working with very large data sets, from initial data ingestion/collection through to end analysis.
+ Likely the candidate would be a graduate from a good university, with at least a 2:1 in a Maths, Statistics or Numerate discipline with strong A Levels.
+ Very strong numerate skills; these will be rigorously tested during assessment.
+ Ability to use SQL is essential and R/Python an advantage.
+ Experience in tools such as Tableau or PowerBI for results presentation/dashboarding.
+ Must have advanced Excel skills, macro & VBA knowledge.
+ Ability to work independently, taking high level project briefs and liaising with internal departments to get hold of the necessary information to produce cogent analytical assessments and present these at board level.
+ Ability to work in a team environment and deal with multiple stakeholder across the business to ensure all teams are pulling together to achieve common goals and success measures.
+ Ability to work to tight deadlines.

Interested? Apply here for a fast-track path to the Hiring Manager

Application notice… We take your privacy seriously. When you apply, we shall process your details and pass your application to our client for review for this vacancy only. As you might expect we may contact you by email, text or telephone. Your data is processed on the basis of our legitimate interests in fulfilling the recruitment process. Please refer to our Data Privacy Policy & Notice on our website for further details.

If you have any pre-application questions please contact us first quoting the job title & ref. Good luck, Team RR.

SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST

£60,000 + BENEFITS

LONDON/ REMOTE

Are you interested in working with large volumes of data for a well-known telecommunication brand that has over 25 million customers in the UK? Are you looking for great opportunity for career progression and growth in a data science team backed heavily by investment? This is the perfect opportunity for an experienced data scientist looking for a new, exciting challenge.

THE COMPANY:

As a Data Scientist, you will be working in the data science team that focuses on modelling complex business problems around improving customer experience through data insights. Previous winners of "Best Network for Customer Service," customer experience is a priority to this well-established brand. The company is currently investing heavily into their data science function and are looking for talented data scientists to grow-out the team and develop within the company and team.

The role of Data Scientist will require you to work with large volumes data and solve business problems and optimise the overall business performance.

Specifically, you can expect to be involved in the following:

  • You will be building end to end machine learning models in python

The successful Data Scientist will have the following skills and experience:

  • Educated to PhD or Master's level (PhD preferred) in a STEM degree focused in quantitative methods and statistics (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics etc)
  • Proficiency in programming languages and statistical analysis tools - Python, Spark, and other ML techniques
  • Proven commercial experience in a customer focused Machine Learning role
  • Proven experience working with building models for customer churn, credit risk/ optimisation, supply chain optimisation etc

THE BENEFITS:

The successful Data Scientist will receive a salary, dependent on experience be up to £60,000. There are other exciting benefits, such as a bonus, health care, pension and a car allowance.

fullDescription:
LEAD DATA SCIENTIST

UP TO £80,000 + BONUS + BENEFITS

MILTON KEYNES

Are you interested in building to a fast emerging, forward-thinking, data-driven team? Are you customer-focused and have a keen interest in improving customer experience worldwide? Do you wish to be at the forefront of data and machine learning practices in the hospitality industry? This opportunity would be an excellent fit for you.

THE COMPANY:

As a lead data scientist, you will develop new machine learning approaches for a multi-national restaurant chain for their UK and Ireland stores. The company is undergoing a digital transformation and are keen to grow out their data science function.

THE ROLE:

As a Lead Data Scientist, you will be focusing on optimisation, automation and machine learning. Extremely customer focused on a macro-scale, you will be involved in a variety of different projects including (but not limited to) focusing on customer behaviour, supply chain and delivery routes optimisation.

In specific, you can expect to be involved in the following:

  • Mining large and complex data sets - both structured and unstructured data including efficient data extraction, transformation and application
  • Causal inference and utilising this data to influence marketing, sales and understanding customer loyalty
  • Predicting customer behaviour and values through machine learning and implementing changes at a large scale
  • Designing models that have real world use and practices in all areas of product sale and production, using Python, Spark, SQL etc
  • Development and maintenance of collaborative relationships with colleagues across the business.

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:

The successful Lead Data Scientist will have the following skills and experience:

  • Masters degree level or higher in numerate subject, such as Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science
  • Comprehensive proficiency in key programming languages (Must-have Python and SQL, desirable AWS and GCP)
  • Previous software development skills and experience
  • Experience mentoring or leading data science teams is preferable

THE BENEFITS:

The successful Lead Data Scientist will receive a salary, dependent on experience, up to £80,000. On top of the salary, there is a performance-based bonus, great culture and opportunity to develop leadership skills as well as learn new skills from experts within the Data Science industry.

HOW TO APPLY:

Please register your interest by sending your CV to Francesca Curtis via the Apply link on this page.

Data Scientist - Econometrics

Data Idols are working with a rapidly growing global e-commerce company who are looking for a contract Data Scientist with an Econometrics specialism to join the existing Data team in London on a contract basis. This role will be remote to start with and as restrictions lift will be based in London.

You will be part of the Data Factory, working together with colleagues in a  mature data function with a growing centralised data platform. The senior role will also take the technical lead of certain data products and will mento...
fullDescription:
About the role:
The successful Senior Data Scientist will be working with our data science platform to develop, deliver and maintain ground-breaking algorithms and analytics on an enterprise level. You will be part of the Data Factory, working together with colleagues in a mature data function with a growing centralised data platform. The senior role will also take the technical lead of certain data products and will mentor and coach the rest of the data scientist team.

Our team adds value by unlocking actionable insights from our data and developing Machine Learning and AI tools that feed into an AI enterprise platform. This is hosted on leading-edge, secure platforms and tooling.

The role will provide exciting challenges and experiences as we progress towards a digital-first, data-driven business. You will work with interesting datasets including asset health, operations, geographical and people to help achieve improvements to real-world problems including leakage, pollution, efficiency and customer service.

Key Accountabilities:
  • Communicate insight & regularly interact with stakeholders
  • Apply problem-solving, creative thinking and leadership skills
  • Apply or advise on the application of statistical modelling and machine learning techniques
  • Mentor and coach data scientists to help build an effective team and increase the capability
  • A/B test and use statistical methods to generate insights and optimise business processes
  • Take the technical lead on data science products
  • Manage our relationship with key stakeholders
To be successful you will have the following skills and experience:
  • You will be resilient and must be able to build credibility quickly
  • A degree in a quantitative discipline such as mathematics, physics, computer science is essential. A postgraduate degree/PhD in a similar field is a significant advantage
  • Experience from working in an industry or academic data scientist job is essential
  • Strong mathematical and statistical analysis skills are essential
  • You must be able to provide examples of your experience of predictive modelling and pragmatic implementation of machine learning techniques to solve real-world problems
  • You must be able to demonstrate a deeper understanding than just applying out-of-the-box models – how they work when they work and why they work.
  • Familiarity with Azure services is an advantage
  • You will be a competent/advanced programmer in Python and SQL
What’s in it for you?
Our competitive salary package includes an excellent contributory pension, 26 days holiday per year increasing to 30 with the length of service and a wider benefits scheme. This includes an annual pay review, season ticket loans, voucher scheme giving you money off in major retail outlets, loyalty awards for continuous service plus much more, including our referral scheme, where you can receive £750 for helping someone get a permanent position within the company. 

We’re also proud to be here for our local community, offering everyone two days paid volunteer to leave a year, as well as proudly supporting a lot of local events and charities. 

About us:
Thames Water is the UK’s largest water and wastewater company. We make a daily difference to millions of customers by supplying 2.7 billion litres of world-class water to around 10 million homes.  

As our world changes, the need to take care of our most precious resource is greater than ever, both locally and globally. That’s why, at Thames Water, every one of our actions, big and small, matters every day. Water is essential to daily life, and that means our business is always open. We’re passionate about providing world-class tap water, now and for the future.

We’re also turning waste into power, self-generating 20% of the energy we use and, in turn, doing our bit for the planet. We’re reducing plastic waste by celebrating our tap water and rolling out an ambitious water fountain project. We’re using our voice to lobby for change and partnering with WaterAid to provide clean water to the world’s poorest communities.

Together, we’re building a better future for our customers, our region and our planet.
Thames Water is a unique, rewarding and diverse place to work. If you join our team, you’ll enjoy fast-tracked career opportunities, flexible working arrangements and unparalleled benefits. We’re also proud to be an equal opportunity employer, Stonewall Diversity Champion and Disability Confident Leader, welcoming individuals from all walks of life and leading the way with award-winning mental health and well-being strategy.

jobDescription: About the role:The successful Data Scientist will be working with our data science platform to develop, deliver and maintain ground-breaking algorithms and analytics on an enterprise level. You will be part of the Data Factory, working together with colleagues in a mature  data function with a growing centralised data platform.Our team adds value by unlocking actionable insights from our data and developing Mac...
fullDescription:
About the role:
The successful Data Scientist will be working with our data science platform to develop, deliver and maintain ground-breaking algorithms and analytics on an enterprise level. You will be part of the Data Factory, working together with colleagues in a mature data function with a growing centralised data platform.

Our team adds value by unlocking actionable insights from our data and developing Machine Learning and AI tools that feed into an AI enterprise platform. This is hosted on leading-edge, secure platforms and tooling.

The role will provide exciting challenges and experiences as we progress towards a digital-first, data-driven business. You will work with interesting datasets including asset health, operations, geographical and people to help achieve improvements to real-world problems including leakage, pollution, efficiency and customer service.

Key Accountabilities:
  • Communicate insight & regularly interact with stakeholders
  • Apply problem-solving and creative thinking skills
  • Deliver and evaluate Data Science algorithms
  • Deliver machine learning pipelines
  • Automate data analysis
  • Advise on mathematical approaches for problem-solving
  • Contribute to product development, support and maintain data science products
To be successful you will have the following skills and experience:
  • You will be resilient and must be able to build credibility quickly
  • A degree in a quantitative discipline such as mathematics, physics, computer science is essential. A postgraduate degree in a similar field is an advantage
  • Strong mathematical and statistical analysis skills are essential
  • You will be a competent/advanced programmer in Python and SQL
  • You will understand machine learning methods and have experience in their application
  • Data engineering skills are essential
  • Agile certification is an advantage
  • Knowledge and experience of the Azure platform and Databricks is an advantage
What's in it for you:
Our competitive salary package includes an excellent contributory pension, 26 days holiday per year increasing to 30 with the length of service and a wider benefits scheme. This includes an annual pay review, season ticket loans, voucher scheme giving you money off in major retail outlets, loyalty awards for continuous service plus much more, including our referral scheme, where you can receive £750 for helping someone get a permanent position within the company. 

We’re also proud to be here for our local community, offering everyone two days paid volunteer leave a year, as well as proudly supporting a lot of local events and charities. 

About us:
Thames Water is the UK’s largest water and wastewater company. We make a daily difference to millions of customers by supplying 2.7 billion litres of world-class water to around 10 million homes.  

As our world changes, the need to take care of our most precious resource is greater than ever, both locally and globally. That’s why, at Thames Water, every one of our actions, big and small, matters every day. Water is essential to daily life, and that means our business is always open. We’re passionate about providing world-class tap water, now and for the future.

We’re also turning waste into power, self-generating 20% of the energy we use and, in turn, doing our bit for the planet. We’re reducing plastic waste by celebrating our tap water and rolling out an ambitious water fountain project. We’re using our voice to lobby for change and partnering with WaterAid to provide clean water to the world’s poorest communities.

Together, we’re building a better future for our customers, our region and our planet.
Thames Water is a unique, rewarding and diverse place to work. If you join our team, you’ll enjoy fast-tracked career opportunities, flexible working arrangements and unparalleled benefits. We’re also proud to be an equal opportunity employer, Stonewall Diversity Champion and Disability Confident Leader, welcoming individuals from all walks of life and leading the way with award-winning mental health and well-being strategy.

fullDescription:
Lead Developer, Python, Senior Data Scientist, AI, CNN, Computer Vision

The New Year brings new opportunities and if you are a Lead Developer / Senior Data Scientist with key skills in Computer Vision, AI, CNN (Convolutional Neural Networks) and Python, this opportunity is for you! My client, an exciting start-up software company, is urgently seeking a skilled and experienced Lead Developer / Senior Data Scientist to join their project team. 

The successful candidate will join this company in its early stages, in order to provide day-to-day leadership/mentorship to other team members as well as produce clean, scalable code all focussed around Artificial Intelligence advancements.

The Company

Joining a start-up requires someone with flexibility, pragmatism and initiative, as well as a willingness to embrace problems to work to find solutions, but the work will be hugely rewarding, as you get to see each day, the impact that you’re having upon the product’s progress. 

As well as working in an exciting and fast-paced environment with worldly applications, the successful candidate with benefit from flexible working including some possibility of remote working.

What’s Required?

To be successful in this position, the chosen Senior Data Scientist / Lead Developer will be required to have:

  • Sound experience developing in Python
  • Experience using either PyTorch or Tenorsflow for CNNs (Convolutional Neural Networks
  • A sound understanding of Computer/Machine Vision
  • Willingness to work with customers within the defence sector
  • Prior experience as a Lead Developer is highly advantageous as well as a MSc or PhD in Machine Learning, Computer Vision or a similar field.
  • Experience working and leading in an Agile team environment is also desirable.

What Next?

If you’re passionate about development and Data Science and the above role sounds like you, apply now for immediate consideration.

Lead Developer, Senior Data Scientist, Python, AI, CNN, Computer Vision, PyTorch, Tenorsflow, Machine Learning

jobTitle: Lead Data Scientist / Data Science Director - CONTRACT
jobDescription: Lead Data Scientist / Data Science Director - CONTRACT RATE - £450 - £550 per day TERM - 3 - 6 months+ LOCATION - Remote then Central London TEAM Having built most of the existing Marketing Sciences function, we can vouch for the exceptional quality of talent this agency has managed to a...
fullDescription:
Lead Data Scientist / Data Science Director - CONTRACT

RATE - £450 - £550 per day

TERM - 3 - 6 months+

LOCATION - Remote then Central London

TEAM

Having built most of the existing Marketing Sciences function, we can vouch for the exceptional quality of talent this agency has managed to attract; not just because of the complexity of data science projects on offer, but also because of the vision of their Marketing Sciences Director. He is passionate about training and development and has built a strong culture of collaboration and innovation. Every single person we’ve placed, LOVES their job and more importantly, LOVES their team! The work life balance is excellent and there is an adult working environment where you are trusted to deliver and given the freedom to manage your own time.

ROLE

In this role apply your advanced analytical skills across a variety of cutting edge data science projects including heat mapping, digital automation and attribution, NLP, machine learning, AI and building recommendation engines.

You will work closely with huge, often, global brands to scope data science and insights projects, delivering high level, complex data science solutions.

We want Hackers, Data Scientist leaders who can add value through bleeding edge techniques and methodologies, all whilst applying an acute commercial and strategic lens. I’m afraid to say experience with predictive modelling and segmentation builds is not enough here, we need people who have something a little different about their background. You will possibly have a data engineering edge to your experience, will be highly proficient in cloud based technologies, maybe you’ve used some special analytical techniques such as gravity modelling or catchment analysis, even worked with geospatial data….we want to hear from you!

Advanced programming skills in Python are required, as well as an all round problem solving approach.

You will present simple and compelling solutions to complex client problems. You should be highly skilled in the latest data science techniques in order to deliver best in class machine learning and AI methodologies and approaches.

Skills and experience required:

  • Educated to degree level in a numerate subject; Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Physics, Chemistry, Economics, Machine Learning, Computer Science etc.
  • A background in data science; (possibly) data engineering, (definitely) machine learning and AI, ideally within a marketing environment
  • Strong programming experience with either Python AND SQL as a minimum
  • Experience of working with cloud based platforms such as Azure, AWS or GCP
  • Ability to gather and scope requirements for a variety of analytical projects
  • Ability to engage with senior level client stakeholders and operate at a senior level on projects

fullDescription:
Senior Data Scientist
London
£105,000 - £110,000 + benefits

Harnham are working exclusively with a Private Equity company in London who are in the process of building a Data Science and Engineering capability.

The company have an impressive Founding Team who hold a strong reputation within Data & Analytics and Private Equity, and are now in the process of significant growth for the next 12 months.

As a business model, they will look to acquire companies who hold significant potential, and through the use of Data Science and Engineering, unlock significant value over a number of years to help improve how that company operates, as well as how that company performs.

As a Data Scientist in this team you will be responsible for identifying key areas of improvement within an organisation, scoping out problems through a data science lens, and through the use of advanced techniques it will be your job to deliver multiple key initiatives to drive business performance and revenue.


The Role - Senior Data Scientist

You will be:

  • Working on multiple engagements within the company's portfolio across various different industry sectors
  • Delivering key Data Science initiatives to help drive business operations and performance
  • Building end-to-end machine learning solutions, as well as driving key strategic insights (you will be a full-stack data scientist)
  • Working alongside a world class team of Data Scientists and Data Engineers (from junior through to Principal/Director level)
  • Translating business challenges and converting them into clear and concise insights which create value


Experience - Senior Data Scientist

You will have:

  • An M.Sc. or Ph.D. in: Machine Learning, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.
  • Experience using Python is a must
  • Knowledge of Spark, Kafka, AWS, Docker, Kubernetes is desirable
  • A strong knowledge of statistical/machine learning models applied to real-world problems
  • A keen interest in problem solving and using scalable machine learning to solve the biggest data-related problems is important
  • A strong interest in working across a variety of different industry sectors and problem areas.


BENEFITS

Up to £110,000 base salary
Competitive bonus + Private Medical + 25 days annual leave
The opportunity to join a world-class and growing team


HOW TO APPLY

Please register your interest by sending your CV via the Apply link on this page. For further details or to enquire about other roles, please contact Nick Mandella at Harnham.


KEYWORDS

Python, SQL, Spark, Kafka, machine learning, statistics, Data Science, Data Scientist, Big Data, Artificial Intelligence.

fullDescription:
Data Scientist
Location: Leamington Spa
18-month contract (minimum)
Immediate start

The UK Government is dedicated to increasing its capacity for Covid-19 testing and is opening two new diagnostic labs in order to process up to 300,000 of these tests a day. I am recruiting in the first of these labs in Leamington Spa for a number of ambitious Data Scientists with experience working in a laboratory setting who want to help make a difference in the current situation by using your analytical experience to help to process large volumes of data.

Key responsibilities:
•    Analysing sample data 
•    Tracking and recording using the LIMS database
•    Processing large data sets
•    Identifying anomalous results 
•    Managing the flow of data out of the laboratories  

Requirements: 
•    A graduate with a BSc, MSc or PhD in a relevant scientific discipline 
•    Experience within a laboratory environment 
•    Experience processing large scientific data sets
•    Knowledge of diagnostic tests, ideally PCR 
•    Experience using databases and data analysis tools 

You will be required to be on site at Leamington Spa, so you will need to be in the commutable area or able to relocate at short notice. This is an exciting opportunity to use your skills in the fight against Covid-19. If you think this may be the role for you, apply by sending your CV to

jobTitle: Data Scientist Ordnance Survey Data Contract
jobDescription: * Ordnance Survey Data Experience Required* Python* SQLOur client is seeking a data scientist to work on core project delivery, taking ownership of and managing data science processes. You will enjoy working with one of the strongest data sets in the country, cutting edge technology, and the ability to see your  insights turned into real products on a regular basis.You will be working to deliver exploratory an...
fullDescription:
* Ordnance Survey Data Experience Required
* Python
* SQL

Our client is seeking a data scientist to work on core project delivery, taking ownership of and managing data science processes. You will enjoy working with one of the strongest data sets in the country, cutting edge technology, and the ability to see your insights turned into real products on a regular basis.

You will be working to deliver exploratory analysis, statistical descriptions, and build predictive models based on consumer, business, and spatial data. Using data-driven methods to power decisions, inform strategy, build robust data products, and identify opportunities for innovation across the company. The role will focus on mining, cleaning, understanding, explaining, and modelling data from various sources, and presenting these findings to a wider audience. The team will be measured on ensuring projects can demonstrate the financial impact of leveraging data analytics and modelling.

You MUST have worked with Ordnance Survey Data and ideally you will have worked with Address data previously. Main tasks include:

* Address/Data Cleansing - Analysis of large data sets to identify key structures and patterns in sector specific address sets, with the aim of identifying a comprehensive and quality assured set of address cleansing rules that can be applied to customer data.
* Data Assurance - Statistical, quantitative and qualitative analysis of processes and results, ensuring auditable results and accurate recording of said results. Ensure documentation and processes are maintained and kept up to date.
* Data Management/Processing - Handling and management of large datasets, ensuring all actions and results are auditable, without data loss or duplication. Delivery of data work packages, receipt of results, collation of results/reports. Statistical reviews etc.
* Contribute to Process Improvement - Continual review of processes and methods; defining new methods and mechanisms.

An ideal data scientist will have a background in a quantitative or technical field, with experience working with large data sets, data analytics or machine learning, and will have some experience in data-driven decision making. We require a result focussed self-starter, who can demonstrate success in using analytics to drive the understanding, growth, and success of a project.

Key Skills:

* SQL/Python/R
* Data manipulation, cleaning, visualisation
* Linear regression, cluster analysis, classification
* Strong statistics
* Strong Leadership and Influencing skills; interacting with senior stakeholders; highly personable
* Excellent written and verbal communication abilities
* High degree of numeracy

If you are interested and would like to be considered for this role please apply now or email

* Data Assurance - Statistical, quantitative and qualitative analysis of processes and results, ensuring auditable results and accurate recording of said results. Ensure documentation and processes are maintained and kept up to date.
* Data Management/Processing - Handling and management of large datasets, ensuring all actions and results are auditable, without data loss or duplication. Delivery of data work packages, receipt of results, collation of results/reports. Statistical reviews etc.
* Contribute to Process Improvement - Continual review of processes and methods; defining new methods and mechanisms.

An ideal data scientist will have a background in a quantitative or technical field, with experience working with large data sets, data analytics or machine learning, and will have some experience in data-driven decision making. We require a result focussed self-starter, who can demonstrate success in using analytics to drive the understanding, growth, and success of a project.

Key Skills:

* SQL/Python/R
* Data manipulation, cleaning, visualisation
* Linear regression, cluster analysis, classification
* Strong statistics
* Strong Leadership and Influencing skills; interacting with senior stakeholders; highly personable
* Excellent written and verbal communication abilities
* High degree of numeracy

If you are interested and would like to be considered for this role please apply now or email

jobTitle: Senior Data Scientist (12 month fixed term contract)
jobDescription: Carnival UK has big plans for the future! Already the market leader, CUK (which operates the P&O Cruises and Cunard Brands) will grow by 50% by 2022 as we add new ships to the fleet and further transform the industry by making cruising a mainstream holiday  for UK guests. This is an exciting opportunity for a highly capable Senior Data Scientist to help deliver even better holidays for customers of our leading t...
fullDescription:
Carnival UK has big plans for the future! Already the market leader, CUK (which operates the P&O Cruises and Cunard Brands) will grow by 50% by 2022 as we add new ships to the fleet and further transform the industry by making cruising a mainstream holiday for UK guests.

This is an exciting opportunity for a highly capable Senior Data Scientist to help deliver even better holidays for customers of our leading travel brands, from within our growing Insight & Analytics team. This is a 12 month fixed term contract opportunity.

You’ll be passionate about our Guests’ experience, great at engaging an Insight-hungry business and ensuring we create unforgettable holiday happiness for our guests!

The Role

As Senior Data Scientist, you will be a strong, highly numerate individual with a strong academic background in a quantitative discipline such as Operations Research, Engineering, Applied Mathematics or Applied Statistics, to conceive and champion new scientific methods in the world of Cruise Revenue Management.

Operating as a subject matter expert in Data Science techniques, the Senior Data Scientist works closely with models such as statistical demand forecasts, decision trees and optimisation models and assists with implementation and adoption of these models into daily business activity within the Revenue Management function for P&O Cruises and Cunard. Upon implementation of models and systems, they will participate in user training and will be responsible for monitoring/maintaining model performance and conceiving / designing enhancements. They will be the technical lead to improve business adoption of our in-house built Revenue optimisation system. They will also build strong relationship with Science community from sister brands and continue to represent Carnival UK in the global forum. This is a key role within our business, as it directly contributes to the higher business strategy and the commercial solutions, by optimising the value derived from data.

About You

You’ll have a top degree (or equivalent) in a field (preferably PhD, or Masters’ Degree with previous industry experience) that has very applicable use of data science / statistics techniques (e.g. statistics, applied math, computer science, OR a science field with direct statistics application), and have a demonstrable background in innovation and problem-solving.

You’ll be fluent in data fundamentals: SQL and R/Python for data manipulation using a procedural language, statistics, experimentation, and advanced modelling. Most importantly, you’ll be passionate about the value of Data Science and its ability to change the world.

You will have strong analytical capabilities with a high level of attention to detail, an ability to communicate complex information to various audiences, and be capable of working independently in a demanding and ambiguous environment.

This position has been levelled at CUK 07.

To view the full job description follow the "apply" link

About Us

Carnival UK is the operating company for P&O Cruises & Cunard. We provide world class cruise holidays and take enormous pride from bringing to life two of the most iconic brands from Britain’s rich seafaring heritage. That legacy of elegance and style, of beautiful ships, inspiring leadership and guest-obsessed service excellence lives on today, as we evolve ourselves for tomorrow.

Working at Carnival UK means being part of a tight-knit but truly global team made up of friendly, happy, caring people. Parts of our business are incredibly diverse, but we work hard every day to promote even greater inclusion, fresh ideas and different perspectives. Whatever our role or background, we share high standards, heartfelt values and a sense of belonging. We’re focused on wellbeing every day, as well as being supportive and compassionate when we need it most.

As a growing business we have a big focus on developing skills and continuous learning. From formal qualification to the life lessons of worldwide travel, we offer our people a broad range of personal and professional development opportunities. All of our roles give people the chance to stretch themselves and learn from colleagues with a wealth of experience. As our business grows, we want our people to grow too. So we’re determined to create opportunities for everyone to drive their development and define their own career path.

About the Team

We are an influential and growing team of thought leaders across Insight, Analytics and Data Governance. We deliver sustainable value through relentless curiosity, brilliant people and strategic insight focused on driving positive action across both of Carnival UK’s great brands, P&O Cruises, the UK market leader, and Cunard, a legendary luxury brand.

The team spans several disciplines, including data science, consumer & guest insight, commercial effectiveness, data governance, systems and personalisation. We are a highly collaborative and innovative team, driving projects and initiatives that will shape our future and continue to deliver unforgettable holiday happiness to our guests.

Join us on our journey - apply now.

jobDescription: Vitality, Pricing Data Scientist, London, £Competitive + Bonus + Benefits We’re the UK insurer and investment provider that rewards people for positive lifestyle choices. With 1.25m+ UK members and more than 25m globally, we’re out to make the world a healthier, happier place. That applies as much to our people as it does to our members. So, as well as a highly competitive pay package, you’ll e...
fullDescription:
Vitality, Pricing Data Scientist, London, £Competitive + Bonus + Benefits

We’re the UK insurer and investment provider that rewards people for positive lifestyle choices. With 1.25m+ UK members and more than 25m globally, we’re out to make the world a healthier, happier place.

That applies as much to our people as it does to our members. So, as well as a highly competitive pay package, you’ll enjoy: complimentary breakfasts; regular onsite physical and mental wellness workshops; on-site health checks; annual flu jabs, and access to our full range of partners and rewards.

It’s what we call offering shared value, because a healthy, happy team is good for us, good for our members, and good for you.

As ourPricing Data Scientist, you’ll get the benefits our members enjoy, including:

- Our award-winning private Vitality Health insurance + wellness incentive programme

- Access to The Vitality Programme – Apple Watch, Waitrose and Partners, Garmin, Amazon Prime, Champneys Spa days, Rakuten TV and half-price gym memberships to name a few!

- Personal health fund + Life Assurance

- Stakeholder Pension Plan with employer contribution

- 25 days annual leave + Bank holidays + option to buy and sell 5 more

- Flexible benefits package

- Internal incentives, competitions, and awards – a chance to win football and sports tickets or even be in with a chance to have a holiday of a lifetime

- A genuine opportunity to grow and establish a long-term career

Joining us as our Pricing Data Scientist you will work on innovative Pricing applications specific to Vitality’s Life insurance business. The primary purpose of this role will be to produce enhanced rating structures and deeper understanding of conversion across all new business that VitalityLife sells.

Responsibilities of ourPricing Data Scientist will include:

- Enhancing and building various models (e.g. market price, conversion, money left on the table, lifetime value etc.) and implementing those models into production where necessary

- Developing a framework to monitor model performance, and refit when necessary

- Enhancing the existing framework for rating structure creation using optimisation techniques and scenario analysis

- Assisting with analytical process enhancements in the wider Pricing team’s work

- Communicating analysis, findings and recommendations to various stakeholders and senior executives

- Sharing insightful modelling techniques and interesting results with the wider Vitality analytics community

Skills and experience of our ideal Pricing Data Scientist:

Essential

- Undergraduate degree in a numerical subject

- Strong command of statistical programming and scripting languages such as R and Python

- Proficient at relational database languages such as SQL and T-SQL

- Deep knowledge of building, interpreting and debugging machine learning models, including models and methods

Desirable

- Masters or other advanced degree in Actuarial Science, Maths, Statistics, Engineering, Physics, Computer Science, or other technical field

- Prior experience building conversion models, market pricing models, MLOT models, lifetime value models

- Setting up or enhancing existing business-critical processes (especially within Pricing, but other areas will be considered)

- Experience with Actuarial / Pricing software such as Prophet, Moses, Earnix, Radar, etc.

Closing Date: Friday 29th January 2021

Working for Vitality, you'll experience an exciting mix of creativity and innovation, within a framework of challenging objectives and a passion for delivering the best.

Our people are chosen for their skills, knowledge, enthusiasm, and attitude but above all, their belief that anything can be achieved.

If you feel you have the skills and experience to become our Pricing Data Scientist,thenplease click ‘apply’ today.

London

A global telco is looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join their business to help build a brand new Data Science function in London.

You will form a team focused on bringing machine learning best-practice into the business to help monetise existing data in new ways - building data science products for 3rd parties and having a direct impact on PnL.

This is a pivotal role and you will be expected to manage 2 Data Scientists.

You will also work on some interesting covid-19 related projects involving analysing real-time locational data.

  • A wealth of experience in the application of machine learning to solve complex business problems

  • Strong communication skills
  • An MSc or equivalent in a statistical/quantitative subejct
  • Strong skills in Python and SQL
  • Experience in using GCP is a bonus
  • A track record in using machine learning to draw hidden insights from data
  • Experience in geospatial analysis a plus.

You can earn up to £100,000 + bonus + benefits in this position.

To be considered for this exciting opportunity, please submit your details using the Apply button on this page. For more information about similar roles please contact Nick Mandella at Harnham.

KEYWORDS

Python, SQL, GCP, AWS, Data Scientist, Data Science, Machine Learning, Supervised Learning, Unsupervised Learning, Telco, Data, Analyst, Analysis, London.

fullDescription:
Senior Data Scientist | Online Gaming | Gibraltar

SRGEurope have been appointed to recruit a Senior Data Scientist. In this role based in our client's fantastic offices in Gibraltar, you will be defining, building and verifying machine learning solutions, optimization engines and statistical models to maximise business value.

Our clients are a major name within the Online Gaming Sector, and need somebody with at least 5 years in a senior role. Our clients are a forward thinking, tech driven company who offer a relaxed, but hard-working team driven environment, and flexible working hours. The teams here really love what they do, and are looking for a like-minded team player to join them.

You may already be working within Online Gaming, or maybe you are from a digitally focussed industry and looking to take your career to the next level.

What's on Offer:

  • A competitive salary, that will also include a bonus and benefits package and flexible working hours
  • An excellent collaborative, team working environment in a fantastic location in the heart of Gibraltar
  • Team and company events throughout the year
  • Discounted gym membership and also discounts and offers for the many bars and restaurants in Gibraltar
  • Relocation assistance
  • 25 days annual leave in addition to the 12 Gibraltar bank holidays

What you will be doing:

  • Applying machine learning approaches, advanced statistical and analytical techniques to extract general patterns and insights from data
  • Understanding how advanced analytic techniques and applications can help solve business problems
  • Enhancing overall customer behavioural profiles and improving company capability for optimized next best action
  • Choosing the best modelling approach for the given business problem
  • Conducting data preparation to integrate data from sources and prepare data ready for modelling and analysis

  • Using advanced data manipulation to produce new features that boost model performance

The Essentials:

  • BSC in computer science, mathematics or statistics
  • Excellent problem solving skills along with experience of data analytics at a senior level
  • Experience with modelling platforms, machine learning techniques, data engineering, statistical analytics and tools development
  • Strong understanding of data mining methodology and experience in rolling out advance data mining models

If you are a highly experienced and talented Senior Data Scientist, and looking to take the next step in your career then this could be the challenge that you are looking for

To Apply

Please click on the 'apply' button and upload your CV and a Cover Letter or alternatively contact Richard Bayliss, Recruitment Consultant on +.

jobDescription: Senior Data Scientist SALARY -                    £60k - £65k plus excellent benefits LOCATION -               Remote, then Central London TEAM Having built most o...
fullDescription:
Senior Data Scientist

SALARY -                    £60k - £65k plus excellent benefits

LOCATION -               Remote, then Central London

TEAM

Having built most of the existing Marketing Sciences function, we can vouch for the exceptional quality of talent this marketing agency has managed to attract; not just because of the complexity of data science projects on offer, but also because of the vision of their Marketing Sciences Director. He is extremely energetic and passionate about training and development, and has built a strong culture of collaboration and innovation off the back of this. Every person we’ve placed into the team in the last 2 years, LOVES their job and more importantly, LOVES their team! The work life balance is excellent and there is an adult working environment where you are trusted to deliver and given the freedom to manage your own time.

ROLE

In this role you will apply your advanced analytical skills across a variety of cutting edge data science projects including building recommendation engines, NLP, machine learning, AI and computer vision, using both supervised and unsupervised machine learning methods.

You will face into (often) global brands to deliver to data science solutions and productionise models, helping the clients better understand their customers and influence their behaviour though advanced analytical techniques.

We want Hackers, Data Scientist leaders who can add value through bleeding edge techniques and methodologies, all whilst applying an acute commercial and strategic lens. I’m afraid to say experience with predictive modelling and segmentation builds is not enough here, we need people who have something a little different about their background. You will possibly have a data engineering edge to your experience, will be highly proficient in cloud based technologies, maybe you’ve used some special analytical techniques such as gravity modelling or catchment analysis, even worked with geospatial data….we want to hear from you! 

Advanced programming skills in Python are required, as well as an all-round problem solving approach.

WHATS IN IT FOR ME?

Exceptionally high level of talent – so peer learning is a reality, you will be inspired by your team, not just senior leaders. Although they are pretty awesome too and lead from the front with clear vision, strategy and commitment to genuinely disrupting what a ling standing approach to analytics from marketing agencies alike. Their approach to date has generated incredible clients and a thirst for more and more advanced data science projects – so the best is yet to come and you could be part of that journey. With their rapid growth, there is huge opportunity for promotion and growth into management, whilst also being able to apply your creativity in solution and product design.

Skills and experience required:

  • Educated to degree level in a numerate subject; Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Physics, Chemistry, Economics, Machine Learning, Computer Science etc.
  • A background in data science; (possibly) data engineering, (definitely) machine learning and AI, ideally within a marketing environment
  • Strong programming experience with either Python AND SQL as a minimum
  • Ability to gather and scope requirements for a variety of analytical projects
  • Ability to engage with senior level client stakeholders to identify and deliver to project briefs

TO APPLY

For further information or to apply please contact:

Kate McDermott  - Managing Consultant @ Blue Pelican Marketing



Share through your CV to 

Text me on

Share through your LI profile if you’re non-active and simply curious

You don’t have to have a CV to find a new job! We’re always keen to talk to good data experts.

For more vacancies which may suit your needs, please visit us at www.bluepelican.com

fullDescription:
A large UK Insurance company is looking to hire a Lead Data Scientist. The business has looked to implement Data Science across the business in 2020 and the Pricing Team is looking to hire their first Data Scientist to drive technical and strategic changes in 2021.

The role will have 6 direct reports and they have plans to hire another 8 Data Scientists in 2021.

This role will be both technical and strategic focused. and will partner with the Head of Pricing and senior stakeholders. The candidate does not need to come from an Insurance background but should have experiencelondon developing Data Science teams. 

They will also offer 3 days WFH and will consider fully remote as well

Lead Data Scientist

- Develop and implement a Data Science strategy for Pricing
- Deliver predictive models that gain a competitive advantage
- Investigate opportunities to source internal and external datasets
- Develop Data Science skills and mindset within the team
- Create an innovative environment, identify value-add initiatives and drive through to implementation

Qualifications

- At least a 2:1 bachelors degree with honours (or equivalent) in an appropriate data science or numerical subject, or, equivalent experience.
- Experience of technical leadership within a Data Science (or equivalent) team.
- Hands on experience of developing predictive models
- An understanding of statistical and mathematical techniques applicable to general insurance pricing, risk selection and analysis.

For more information, please apply to this advert!

fullDescription:
Principal Data Scientist
London
£125,000 - £135,000 + benefits

Harnham are working exclusively with a Private Equity company in London who are in the process of building a Data Science and Engineering capability.

The company have an impressive Founding Team who hold a strong reputation within Data & Analytics and Private Equity, and are now in the process of significant growth for the next 12 months.

As a business model, they will look to acquire companies who hold significant potential, and through the use of Data Science and Engineering, unlock significant value over a number of years to help improve how that company operates, as well as how that company performs.

As a Principal Data Scientist in this team you will be responsible for identifying key areas of improvement within an organisation, scoping out problems through a data science lens, and through the use of advanced techniques it will be your job to deliver multiple key initiatives to drive business performance and revenue.


The Role - Principal Data Scientist

You will be:

  • Leading engagements from a technical perspective and acting as a key thought-leader on several high profile projects
  • Working across multiple engagements within the company's portfolio, across various different industry sectors
  • Combining technical and commercial skills to help drive business operations and performance within the portfolio
  • Building end-to-end machine learning solutions, as well as driving key strategic insights (you will be a full-stack data scientist)
  • Working alongside a world class team of Data Scientists and Data Engineers (from junior through to Principal/Director level)
  • Translating business challenges and converting them into clear and concise insights/recommendations which generate significant value


Experience - Principal Data Scientist

You will have:

  • Experience in leading high profile data science projects which demonstrate value and commercial impact.
  • An M.Sc. or Ph.D. in: Machine Learning, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.
  • Experience using Python is a must
  • Knowledge of Spark, Kafka, AWS, Docker, Kubernetes is desirable
  • A strong knowledge of statistical/machine learning models applied to real-world problems
  • A keen interest in problem solving and using scalable machine learning to solve the biggest data-related problems is important
  • A strong interest in working across a variety of different industry sectors and problem areas.


BENEFITS

Up to £135,000 base salary
Competitive bonus, Private Medical Insurance, 25 days annual leave
The opportunity to join a world-class and growing team


HOW TO APPLY

Please register your interest by sending your CV via the Apply link on this page. For further details or to enquire about other roles, please contact Nick Mandella at Harnham.


KEYWORDS

Python, SQL, Spark, Kafka, machine learning, statistics, Data Science, Data Scientist, Big Data, Artificial Intelligence.

OVERVIEW

The Harnham Data Science team are currently working with a fintech company based in London who have achieved notable success in recent years and have won numerous awards for their market-leading product!

They have scaled up their data capability over the last 2 years (including building out a brand new Data Science and machine learning team) and this position will become a part of that growth and success!

You will be working within a talented team of Data Scientists, Software Engineers, Data Engineers and Product Managers, responsible for utilising your knowledge of statistics/machine learning to solve problems in credit risk, digital and fraud.

There is a great culture here, particularly if you are keen to work in a learning environment.

On a daily basis you will be:

fullDescription:
Data Scientist

Data Scientist required for a fast growing and forward-thinking Consultancy as they continue to win new and interesting data projects.

Your new role …

You'll be joining a really talented team of Data Scientists, Engineers, Architects and a wider team of Product Mangers, Software Engineers and Consultants.

No need to be worried about this being another data science role with no interesting projects, or even worse no data! The team have plenty of work to be getting on with and as they are a Consultancy and trusted partner across a variety of industries, you will have the chance to be involved in an array of work. This includes the financial services sector looking at machine learning for crime detection and anti-money laundering to large scale NHS projects using your data skills for good.

You …

You'll be well versed as a Data Scientist, ideally having worked in a customer or business facing role. A huge part of this role will be talking to a selection of stakeholders from super technical to complete non-techies. You need to be able to explain your solutions to both seamlessly.

I won't patronise you here by saying you'll need experience of Python, SQL or R - you're a data scientist after all …

An appreciation of various cloud providers would be pretty beneficial though as they work in various environments depending on the customer with a recent push in GCP projects, but as you'd expect plenty of Azure and AWS work as well. A certification in one or more of these would be a bit of a cherry on top.

The company …

A boutique data consultancy within a larger organisation, delivering some impressive and complex projects in various sectors.

You will have the opportunity to progress your career with well defined bandings and regular feedback.

The Senior Management are still very hands on and not in a micro-management, can't let go sort of way, they are still very passionate about the success of the business.

The Small Print … (AKA salary & benefits)

You will be working remotely initially - obviously, but in the future, there is an expectation to be on client site up to 4 times a week, which can be UK wide. This is a Consulting gig, so you'll need to be comfortable with that.
In reality, they will try spread the work as locally as possible and there is a good chance a lot of customers will be happy with remote work going forward.

But you need to be prepared to travel as part of the role.

Salary wise, there is a wide range on offer as they have multiple roles, but to help you drum down a bit, somewhere between £45-80k + benefits.

Please do hit apply and contact Tom Edmondson at Cathcart Associates for a more detailed chat on the role, the company and what you are looking for.

jobDescription: Job Title: Data Scientist Business Unit: Big Data; CIO -Data Solutions  Location: Glasgow/ Newcastle upon Tyne Salary: Starting from £39,689 - £51,055 per annum DOE Contract Type: Permanent  Can you support us in championing data science? We’ve grown, and we’ve got big plans for the future....
fullDescription:
Job Title: Data Scientist

Business Unit: Big Data; CIO -Data Solutions

Location: Glasgow/ Newcastle upon Tyne

Salary: Starting from £39,689 - £51,055 per annum DOE

Contract Type: Permanent

Can you support us in championing data science?

We’ve grown, and we’ve got big plans for the future. We’re on an exciting journey as we bring our brands together. It’s a fun and fast-paced place to be, and we want you to help take us to the next level.

As Virgin Money executes its Data Strategy and continues to build a strategic data asset (the data fabric) on AWS we have a Data Science opportunity to really exploit the combined data of all heritages from the platform and provide actionable insight.

We're looking for an experienced Data Scientist to support us in delivering data insights and solutions to a variety of business areas. We’re looking for someone who can communicate effectively with our stakeholders, understand business needs and translate these into actionable outputs. The ideal candidate is a team player with strong knowledge of data science techniques complemented with the soft skills to present results of the projects. Sound good? Read on…

What would my day look like?

You’ll be responsible for carrying out a diverse portfolio of analytical and machine learning projects, focused on different areas across the bank. Our stakeholders often require our expertise to define the areas in which data science can help them. As such, you will have excellent communication skills and become a Data story teller advising how Machine Learning can support Business areas realise their core objectives. You will determine the best technical solution without necessarily needing explicit requirements.

You’ll have a keen eye for detail and be proactive in gaining useful insights from the various sources of data that can aid the business in their decision making and enhance our customer centric outlook.

You’ll be highly motivated in advocating the use of data and machine learning within the business. You will work in a Data Science Innovation Lab environment taking part in design sprints, to provide knowledge from a data perspective. More often, this will be through your projects and interactions with the stakeholders. That being said, the majority of the work being undertaken will be analytical, involving extracting statistical summaries, capturing trends and joining data from various sources to enhance insights. A key part of this is the ability to visualise and communicate the output of your work to engage stakeholders and ensure it delivers value to the business.

Team work is a vital part of this work. Whether it be combining analytical outcomes with others, proof-reading and editing other data scientists’ code; gathering insight from SME’s and incorporating the knowledge they share; and acknowledging when other members of the team should be responsible for stages of a projects such as data engineering.

What’s missing?

We are looking for a go-getter. We want you to drive and promote our Digital-First message and to be passionate about customer experience, data usage and continuous improvement. We’d love it if you had:

  • Experience of SQL (Oracle, MySQL, HiveQL etc.) together with an understanding of how relational database systems work
  • Experience using R or Python for data analysis and a working knowledge of data manipulation tools within either language (dplyr, pandas etc.)
  • Understanding of data manipulation, cleansing and data mining techniques
  • Understanding of Big Data technologies and methodologies (Hadoop, Spark, MapReduce, HIVE etc.)
  • Excellent presentation skills, including Data Visualisation, oral and written communication skills (Tableau experience beneficial)
  • Knowledge of statistical analysis methodologies, with experience of applying Machine Learning techniques

Apply now!

RED HOT Rewards

• A generous holiday package and the option to buy more!

• Private Medical Insurance - with the option to extend to family members.

• Pension! A market leading pension – we’ll top up your contributions too.

• Flexible benefits – customise your rewards to work for you!

Inclusion at Virgin Money

Inclusion is at the heart of everything we do here at Virgin Money. It’s good for you, it’s good for us and it’s amazing for our customers. We know that great minds don’t think alike, so we rely on your diverse thoughts, feelings, beliefs and backgrounds to be the best we can possibly be. Got any questions about this or need some support with your application? We’d love to hear from you so get in touch with our friendly team at or

Point to note…

At the minute, depending on which team you are joining, lots of us are working from home. This is something that may change over time, and if so, we will come together in one of our hub locations, giving you the chance to meet your new colleagues in person. We will of course, make sure you have the IT equipment to access our systems and to interact digitally with your new team and colleagues, but we thought it best to let you know this in advance, so you can make sure you are set up to work safely and productively. If you have any questions on this let us know!

Now the legal bit…

If we offer you a job and you accept, there are some checks we need to complete before you can start with us. This will include a credit and criminal record check, as well as providing 3 years' worth of satisfactory references.

Working within a growing Analytics function, you'll work to produce highly effective predictive models relevant to customer-engagement strategy.

My client, an eCommerce firm based in the Newcastle area seek a Data Scientist with a minimum of 2 years' experience to join at an exciting time as they expand their Data Science capability. Working within a growing Analytics function, you'll work to produce highly effective predictive models relevant to customer-engagement strategy.

Key Responsibilities:

- To pioneer innovative solutions in developing statistical models that will support customer engagement and digital marketing strategies.
- Use of Machine Learning techniques to understand, identify and remedy commercial problems with sufficient solutions.
- Use both internal and external data-sets to interpret, evaluate and produce a range of statistical models to create recommendations on future customer engagement strategy.
- Be responsible for the training the ML models and taking accountability for performance of these models once they're live.
- Champion continuous improvement in relation to Data Science and predictive activities.

Key Requirements:
- Minimum of 2 years' as a Data Scientist
- An MSc in a Data Science or STEM related subject.
- Previous use of modelling techniques that spans: Logistic/Linear regression, Random Forests, CHAID, Customer Analysis, Neural Networks, MARS, SMV etc
- Strong experience with Data Mining.
- Strong practical experience and application of: SQL and the following: Python, R, SAS, Matlab, PySpark.
- An ability to explain highly technical concepts into quantifiable business terms to non-technical stakeholders.

If you're a Data Scientist looking for a role within a highly-successful eCommerce organisation in the Newcastle area, get in touch today!

A Data Scientist is required to join a market leading organisation that are at the forefront of using Data Analytics to aid drug discovery. You will be joining the company's already well-established data team who are using cutting-edge technologies to make advancements within the healthcare industry.

You will be required to support and grow the Data Science activities, especially within text analytics, and provide both hands-on and strategic expertise across their multiple and diverse projects. You will be at the forefront of using Data Science to aid drug discovery, which at the moment, is obviously a very interesting time.

This positions is very NLP focused, so key requirements for this position include:

  • Expertise in Python
  • Expertise in text mining, Natural Language Processing, e.g. Named Entity Recognition, Relation Extraction.
  • Using industry standard frameworks, e.g. Tensorflow, Keras
  • Experience with Recurrent Neural Networks is desirable.
  • Experience within Life Science is desirable

Due to covid, interviews will be conducted remotely. Initially, the position will be home-based and when normality returns you will be required to go to the office twice a week.

If this could be of interest contact Adam de Smit at X4 Technology or apply here. If you could be interested in alternative Data Science position please get in touch with him via Linkedin.

fullDescription:
Data Scientist

This is a truly unique opportunity to apply your Machine Learning skills to one of society’s most important problems. Our client is recruiting for a Data Scientist to direct and implement ongoing Machine Learning activities. Your work will help fight crime, support law enforcement and moderation teams around the world.

You will be assigned a high level of responsibility from day one, charged with leading the front of our technology development. You will be responsible for further developing the technology by conducting training experiments (at our offices and in Government facilities), advancing our toolset, researching new approaches, curating and processing data, as well as liaising with our Government contacts and our commercial team. You will be given support by highly experienced research managers and machine learning experts. There will be opportunity to lead a dedicated team of engineers in the pursuit of our goals as the company grows.

Requirements:

  • You will have a very strong academic record including a Degree (2:1) in a Machine Learning field or closely related subject
  • You will have 2-3 years+ of real-world Machine Learning experience, including Convolutional Neural Networks and other Deep Learning approaches. You will have an in-depth understanding of different CNN architectures, training schemes, and frameworks
  • As well as an excellent understanding and intuition for Machine Learning algorithms, you will have experience with real-world data engineering including pre-processing data, managing datasets, and so on
  • You will have strong software skills and be comfortable working with Python, Docker and Linux
  • Highly competitive salary
  • High levels of autonomy and responsibility
  • The chance to make a real and substantial contribution to society
  • A level of vetting is required for this role

jobDescription: Junior Data Scientist/Data Analyst Our client are at an exciting phase, with ambitions to expand its range of tradeable financial products, providing innovative risk management options for their industry, and for investors. The data function provides quantitative expertise to the  ongoing maintenance, quality assurance and development of its benchmark indices. It manages the technical design, testing and imple...
fullDescription:
Junior Data Scientist/Data Analyst

Our client are at an exciting phase, with ambitions to expand its range of tradeable financial products, providing innovative risk management options for their industry, and for investors. The data function provides quantitative expertise to the ongoing maintenance, quality assurance and development of its benchmark indices. It manages the technical design, testing and implementation of new financial products, and operates the analytical framework that underpins the quality assurance cycle of our FCA regulated benchmarks.

  • Bachelors or Postgraduate degree in computer science, maths, statistics, economics or related disciplines
  • Familiarity with authoring and querying APIs, particularly for regular use within data analysis pipeline - understanding of Graphql would be a bonus
  • Strong understanding of the capabilities of Microsoft Excel, and familiarity with M
  • Python programming skills (e.g. data manipulation and analysis)
  • Solid Statistical Competency, particularly with time series analysis, but crucially a scientific approach to understanding and testing new ideas, as well as identifying patterns in financial data
  • Interest in financial markets, and particularly with derivative products
  • Confidence in creating visualisations and dashboards
  • Understanding of the Azure Cloud Analytical stack
  • Strong written English skills

This role will support several key areas

  • Data Visualisation for internal stakeholders
  • Supporting with scoping, prototyping and testing developments for our benchmarks
  • Refining and maintaining the ingestion pipelines used for internal analytics
  • Supporting, and developing the automated statistical quality metrics run on our products
  • Exploratory research to support the validity and/or the relevance of our benchmarks, such as the use of historical transactional and market data
  • Reporting functions for the finance function which has recently moved to Business Central Dynamics

This function within the organisation is new, but with extremely rapid development having taking place and highly ambitious goals to expand. Accordingly, the successful applicant must be comfortable tacking brand-new problems and enjoy applying their statistical skills in a creative way. Equally the role will be a broad one, with strong internal demand for support with data analysis across a number of projects. Most importantly a successful applicant must be willing to acquire deep subject matter expertise on the Indices themselves, and on the derivatives market: this is a complex, rich and fascinating set of instruments, so intellectual curiosity and a good memory is critical.

fullDescription:
Data Scientist - Central London - £60000 - £80000

Wade Macdonald are excited to be working with a highly successful boutique consultancy based in London who are looking to add a lead Data Scientist to their team. You will be working with leading FTSE companies as they bring cutting-edge, innovative solutions, powered by DigitalDNA, to life. They combine subject-matter expertise with strategy, technology and transformation consultancy to provide our clients with clear value.

About the Role

You will join the business as part of the senior leadership team, being the lead data scientist. Along with the duties / objectives below you will manage two members of staff, supporting their development as well as assigning tasks to them.

  • You will be expected to lead the development of an artificially intelligent system that breaks down a project into the skills and resources needed to fulfil the demand for various clients across law and financial services.
  • Collect data, performed feature engineering and integrated multiple machine learning algorithms and created a Rest API. Deployed the code to an AWS machine.
  • Your main areas of focus will be 5g, Blockchain, IoT as well as digital transformation
  • You will also be working with Cambridge and Imperial College London undergraduates throughout the year who will help with code and delivery.

The Successful Candidate:

You will have experience in the majority of things below.

  • Expertise in the field of Data Science & Artificial Intelligence
  • Being able to understand client needs from technical perspective
  • Target Driven
  • Strong hands on coding ability
  • Experience in leading and developing junior data scientist
  • Knowledge of techniques including, Machine learning, Deep Learning, NLP, Time Series, graph data analytics, pattern detection etc.
  • Experience using Python, Spark or R
  • Knowledge and experience using SQL
  • Use of the up to date Data Science platforms, Experience building and deploying solutions to Cloud (AWS, Google Cloud & Azure)

What you will receive in return

Along with having a great opportunity to step up into the senior management team and be able to have impact into the strategic development of the organisation you will benefit from:

  • Remote Working
  • Very Competitive Salary
  • Centrally located office should you need/want to go in

Next Steps:

Apply to this advert and I will be in touch!

Applications are encouraged from all candidates meeting or exceeding the minimum criteria for the role regardless of age, disability, gender, orientation, race, religion or ethnicity.

fullDescription:
Job title: Project Data Scientist
Location: Hertfordshire / Remote working
Salary: Competitive salary, share options and profit share

Client is a services and technology provider in the recruitment industry. Formed in 2014, client has been serving a growing list of satisfied clients supplying innovative products and services.

Role Background:

The role is to work on the company’s newest product, which is a web-service that disaggregates job descriptions automatically extracting skills, key terms, job roles, quantitatively classifying the content and generating visualizations. The first version of the product is live and has gained considerable client interest. The next step is to enhance the coverage of the system to encompass all possible work domains.

Role Responsibilities

The Project Data Scientist will be tasked with developing a machine learning based process that performs Automatic Keyword Extraction (AKE) from job description text. The process will need to be an unsupervised machine learning process that can scan a set of job descriptions, detecting word and phrase patterns within them, and classifying those terms according to industry sector and work domain.

The Project Data Scientist will need to work independently and provide regular clear updates to the Development Manager demonstrating progress and explaining the technical background. The code produced will need to be clean and efficient and documented.

Essential Skills

• Python
• SQL
• NLTK/spaCy
• Previous experience of extraction of domain specific keywords
• Knowledge of LF-IDF, LDA, TextRank
• Machine learning with Python e.g. scikit-learn
• Topic Modeling
