fullDescription:
The Data Scientist NLP position will provide the Text Analytics Data Scientist with the opportunity to develop systems that enable the analysis and interpretation of large-scale, complex and time specific datasets. This member of the team will need an understanding of how to develop efficient text-mining and analytics solutions in our privacy conscious and commercially sensitive setting.

Client Details

We are a Not For Profit organisation who use data to look for insight and innovation for the discovery of new drugs and medicines. based in Alderley Edge on the Astrazeneca site, we sit in between Academia and the commercial world, currently we are in a phase of rapid growth and require a Data Scientist NLP to join our existing Data Science team.

Description

Main duties and responsibilities:

Develop and support our text-mining development and analytics capabilities

Develop highly-scalable approaches across a broad variety of document types

Identify and support opportunities to apply text analytics approaches on behalf of strategic partners and collaborators

Work with others to successfully deploy solutions to collaborators

Maintain excellent written records of work

Profile

Qualifications and Expertise:

Expertise in text-mining, Natural Language Processing, e.g. Named Entity Recognition, Relation Extraction.

Expertise in using Python including NLP and ML packages

Expertise in processing life-science (biology, chemistry and medical documents)

Expertise in lexicon building, ontologies and industry standards

Expertise in implementing machine learning/deep learning solutions using industry standard frameworks e.g. Tensorflow, Keras

Job Offer

This role would be suitable for anybody travelling from Manchester, Macclesfield, knutsford, Northwich, Warrington, Liverpool area, however remote working is available if you live further away.

As well as a competitive salary, this would be an opportunity to collaborate with a highly qualified team of Data Scientists who are experts in there field.

The role of the Data Scientist NLP is to mine data to further understand the next generation of drugs and medicines

Not for Profit

pharmaceutical

fullDescription:
Data Scientist

Data Scientist required for a leading service provider in London .This company are the market leaders for their industry.

We are looking to heavily invest in their Data function, and we are now hiring Data Scientist to work on a greenfield project transforming the business into a data-driven environment. You'll be working on an exciting range of projects using classical machine learning techniques from conception through to production

THE ROLE

As a Data Scientist you will be Initially working on a pricing engine for quick quote, as well as working out how we can predict success and offer boost points.

You will be looking at how we can best utilise customer data, proposing problem solving approaches and projects. You will prototype, test, and improve data science models and work with colleagues to deploy them, document and present them to the business.

You will be joining a growing team, we currently have a data analyst/dwh developer, however we will also be hiring a machine learning engineer in the next few weeks. You will be providing guidance and support for them as you are leading the projects.

EXPERIENCE

  • Experience providing advanced analytics in a customer, retail & consumer, marketing, or other front office context
  • Professional record demonstrating business impact; domain experience in areas such as customer analytics, CRM, customer acquisition and retention, marketing effectiveness, consumer sentiment and retail businesses will be beneficial.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills, including the ability to explain and present the findings of technical work to non-expert audiences
  • End to end project delivery and proven ability to handle multiple project commitments simultaneously
  • Strong technical expertise in data science, statistical modelling and/or machine learning, fluency with machine learning and data science packages

WHY WORK FOR US?

You will be joining a brand-new team and working on exciting greenfield projects. You will be able to choose the tech and tooling you want to work with, as well as identify potential for new initiatives.

We have plans for significant growth in the next 2 years, so there will be lots of opportunities for progression.

I have interview slots for next week

SO APPLY NOW !

fullDescription:
Data Scientist urgently required for a one of a kind Scottish Data Analytics business who offer extensive flexible working as they take over the US and European markets ensuring Data Protection is adhered to. This is the opportunity to get on-board with a company who are the only experts in their field - writing the rule book so to speak.

You:
Your will come from a strong academic background holding either a PhD or Masters in Statistics, Data Science or related subjects. Due to the sensitivity of the work you will be doing, meticulous attention to detail will be required as you help businesses protect vital personal information from being accessed and utilised. You will be a team player, an out of the box thinker with strong interpersonal skills as client facing work will be required.

What are the key responsibilities?
** Data Manipulation, Integration, Processing and Interrogation of very large data sets.
** Produce comprehensive reports of your findings.
** Liaise with clients (via telephone or video) and present your findings
** Suggest innovative ways in which clients can better protect their data privacy and security.
** Keep up to date with latest data legislation across different continents.

Experience & Knowledge
** Industry or academic experience working with large data sets.
** Expert knowledge in one or more data analysis packages (Python, R etc).
** Ideally be able to demonstrate ability to produce comprehensive statistical reports.
** Good interpersonal and communication skills
** Any experience or knowledge in data privacy and legislation would be beneficial but not essential.

This really is the opportunity to work with a business who are working on nothing but greenfield projects in a unique market where you will effectively be writing the rule book. You will have the freedom to use the tools you want and a clear path set out from day one for career progression.

If this position sounds of interest, please call Tom Edmondson at Cathcart Associates for more details.

**The Role**

This role will involve providing your expertise and logical thinking in a way that helps to develop exciting new analytical solutions for intricate business obstacles.

Data scientists in this consulting team work sector agnostically, however there is current a need for individuals to bring expertise in life sciences, which means that the likely focus of your projects will be with pharma clients. Your role will focus on the delivery of a variety of projects; from developing bots to developing collaborative filtering recommendation engines. You will gain exposure to a wide range of programming languages and cloud platforms.

Your role bridges the gap between complex analytics and management strategy of businesses, a core responsibility is explaining technical outcomes to non-technical stakeholders.

What to expect:

- A strong basic salary with excellent benefits
- Collaboration with high-end and blue-chip clients
- Working within a well-established data science team, over 150 heads
- The opportunity to work with cutting-edge tools and software

**The Candidate**

- Over 2 months years of data science experience
- Pharmaceutical sector expertise
- A commercially insightful and results-driven nature
- An excellent level of consulting communication skills
- A numerical degree with a minimum 2:1 grade or equivalent from a reputable university

jobDescription: Your new roleHighways England is continuing to grow its Data Science team as the importance of a fast paced, customer focused and data-rich world we work in continues to move forward. As a Lead Data Scientist, you will be the support projects through the data science life  cycle - from concept through to delivery, working closely with the organisation and Principal Data Scientist to generate ideas and bring them to lif...
fullDescription:
Your new role
Highways England is continuing to grow its Data Science team as the importance of a fast paced, customer focused and data-rich world we work in continues to move forward. As a Lead Data Scientist, you will be the support projects through the data science life cycle - from concept through to delivery, working closely with the organisation and Principal Data Scientist to generate ideas and bring them to life through design and build. You will use your previous experience and knowledge to provide technical advice as you work with the supply chain and stakeholders to ensure timely delivery of key projects.

This role has the flexibility to be based from any of our National offices but the successful candidate will be required to travel when necessary to Birmingham and Bedford.

What you’ll be leading on

  • Assist in improving the organisations data science capability through the introduction of technology and process
  • Delivery of data science projects through the full life cycle
  • Providing technical advice and direction of data science projects to the organisation
  • Acting as advocate for a data driven organisation, and establishing ways of extracting maximum value from our data.

To be successful

  • Technical understanding of data science technical and commercial issues and challenges
  • Exceptional communication skills to convey complex information to a wide audience and influence as necessary
  • Ability to work collaboratively to gain involvement and engagement, with a range of colleagues and key stakeholders both in the wider organisation and externally
  • Demonstrable experience of working successfully with agile methodologies
  • Demonstrable experience developing & delivering data science strategies

A bit about us
The Information and Technology Directorate is a growing and vibrant team and there has never been a better time to join us as we go through our transformation programme. We are helping to transform the way Highways England operates by delivering digital, data and technology services from frontline to back office, in a modern and efficient way. Our vision is to develop integrated information and technology that empowers our colleagues and provides real time information to our customers, integration with intelligent vehicle and transport systems as they develop, to improve journey safety and reliability.

Why you should join us
At Highways England we believe in a connected country. We are passionate about creating a culture where colleagues feel connected, included and enjoy greater wellbeing to achieve this. We’re proud that as an organisation we are continually striving to do better and actively encourage and support our colleagues to do the same with their careers.

So if you put safety first, take ownership of your work, show passion for what you do, work effectively in a team, and demonstrate integrity in how you do it - then you’ll be a great fit for our organisation

And finally
We reserve the right to close before the advertised closing date, so we recommend completing your application as soon as possible.

fullDescription:
Data Scientist
Buckinghamshire
£55,000 - £65,000

This is an exciting new opportunity for a Data Scientist to join a well-known market-leader in their industry.

THE COMPANY

This company are the market leaders for their industry and they have a great presence within the UK. They have recently invested heavily in their Data function and they are now hiring Data Scientist to join their wider Data Strategy function. You'll be working on an exciting range of projects working with data from various sources (memberships, events and online data) with the overall aim of improving customer experience. You'll be using working with many other teams in the business and using both simple and advanced Data Science and machine learning techniques so this role offers great variety.

THE ROLE

As a Data Scientist for the business you will:

  • You'll look at customer data from both memberships, events and online and looking at ways you can use Data Science techniques to improve the overall customer experience and increase personalisation
  • You'll be working with various teams across the business including: Marketing, Sales, Business Development to get projects completed
  • You'll be driving the new Machine Learning approach through the business, offering new ideas of how to use Data Science and challenging the wider team when necessary

SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

  • Bachelors/Masters in a numerical field is essential (Mathematics, Physics, Quant)
  • An excellent understanding and proven commercial experience using machine learning techniques
  • Experience working with customer data and using segmentation / personalisation techniques would be useful
  • Tech: Python, SQL

SALARY AND BENEFITS

  • Basic salary £55,000 - £65,000
  • Benefits

HOW TO APPLY

Please register your interest for this role by sending your CV to Rosie O'Callaghan via the apply link on this page

Please note that our client is currently running a fully remote interview process and able to on-board and hire remotely as well. This role is intended to be home working for the duration of the pandemic.

fullDescription:
Data Scientist

Working within a team of Data Scientists, Software Engineers and Data Engineers, the successful candidate will be responsible for:

- Applying techniques from ML and stats to develop new features for predictive maintenance products
- Exploring new ML ideas and developments
- Developing and operating model evaluation pipelines
- Testing and deploying the latest systems on custom IoT hardware
- Contributing to the R&D roadmap of new product features
- Presenting and showcasing team achievements to internal and external stakeholders

Essentials:

- A natural collaborator, able to partner effectively with others to achieve demanding objectives.
- Have a good working knowledge of electrical engineering
- Proficient in Python and its scientific libraries (numpy, scipy, sklearn, matplotlib).
- Postgraduate qualification in computer science, applied mathematics, statistics, AI, ML or another relevant mathematical discipline.
- Have experience in a collaborative software team using version control and agile development
- Proficiency with software testing and using TDD and code reviews to ensure high code quality
- Experience implementing ML algorithms and working with large datasets
- Enjoy staying on top of the latest developments in ML algorithms and software
- Have excellent written and verbal communication skills including presentation skills

Desirables:

- Experience with relational databases and ORMs.
- Experience working with Tensorflow Lite & Keras
- Experience with data pipeline technologies (i.e Airflow)
- Previous experience of working with Linux platforms and being proficient with IoT RTOS’s or on-the-metal code development.
- Experience implementing solutions based on supervised and unsupervised learning, pattern recognition, Bayesian statistics, time series analysis,
- HMMs, latent variable methods and neural nets
- A record of publication in the ML literature.
- A record of achievement in Kaggle or other machine learning competitions.
- Degree or postgraduate diploma in an engineering/science discipline.

fullDescription:
Are you looking to expand your career path in the pharmaceutical industry and develop your scientific skills? We have a unique opportunity for you to demonstrate your scientific data expertise within the leading EU institution of medicines and pharmacology based in Amsterdam!

We are the exclusive recruiters for the interim positions at the European Medicines Agency (EMA). The EMA are the medical regulatory organisation responsible for public human and animal health throughout the European Economic Area. They are now looking for a Data Scientist to join them on an initial 9-month temporary (Interim) contract. Deadline to send CVs is Monday 18/01.

You would be providing expert input to resolve data processing, data analysis and data integration challenges. This is an exciting opportunity to join an institution that provides a truly international working environment where everyone is passionate about public health.

Your responsibilities will include:

  • Computation of pharmacovigilance fees and maintenance of EURD list
  • Performing data analyses to support referral and periodic safety update procedures
  • Contribute to data management and data analyses activities on data sets under HCD workstream's responsibility
  • Support stakeholders' engagement and provide stakeholder support via service desk
  • Support the Real-World Metadata, Quality Frameworks & Catalogues project

Profile:

  • University Degree in pharmacy, medicine or science
  • Higher degree or work experience related to data science
  • Preferably with knowledge of and experience with SAS (statistical software)
  • Excellent organisational, communication and time management skills
  • Fluency in English and at least one other EU language -Spanish, Czech, Danish, German, Estonian, English, French, Italian, Latvian, Lithuanian, Hungarian, Maltese, Dutch, Polish, Portuguese, Slovenian, Slovakian, Finnish, Swedish, Greek, Romanian, Bulgarian, Croatian, Norwegian, Icelandic

To apply, please send your CV in English and in Word format to Jessica.

fullDescription:
Our Client is a rapidly expanding National Digital Print Solutions Company. With offices in London and Newcastle they are looking to recruit a Data Scientist to join a newly centralised team. Based in the North East you will be working to take the business to the next level in terms of how they use data through Personalisation, Customer Experience AI and Relevance algorithms, with a focus on "What-if" analysis and Forecasting.

You will be supported through mentoring, training and experience provided as part of their continuing professional development.

Responsibilities including:

· Be responsible for building models that substantially improve current business operations and Marketing performance

· Be responsible for the performance of these models in production

· Be a subject matter expert on data mining and modelling at scale. Identify opportunities for improvement

· Ensure all documentation is up to date and proportionate to business requirements

· Deliver ad hoc analytical projects and / or research as required

· Gathering and translating business needs into appropriate technical and functional requirements

· Design, development and rollout of effective data repositories to support our reporting objectives

· Utilising best practice, develop and maintain ETL functionality and data platforms using SSIS additional tools and relevant scripting

Requirements

· Good knowledge of Microsoft SQL stack including SSIS, SSRS and SSAS

· Experienced with relational database technologies and concepts

· Experience working in a commercial environment with the ability to work collaboratively, as well as to handle workflow in accordance with project timelines is required

· Good communication skills to technical audiences, able to explain complex topics in simple terms, adapting communication technical depth to the audience

· Strong business/commercial sense to combine with analytics to help drive recommendations; ability to demonstrate an understanding of the commercial impact of their activities

· Working knowledge of statistics: hypothesis testing, confidence intervals and A/B tests

· Experience of R or Python an advantage.

· Customer focused

· Educated to degree level

Salary: £35,000 plus benefits

We connect the world of science to advance chemical knowledge for a better  future.Location : Cambridge or home-based within the UK if suitable, in line with Covid-19 guidance.Salary: £50,184 to £55...
fullDescription:
The RSC is the world’s leading chemistry community, an internationally renowned publisher of high-quality chemical science knowledge and the professional body for chemists in the UK. We connect the world of science to advance chemical knowledge for a better future.

Location : Cambridge or home-based within the UK if suitable, in line with Covid-19 guidance.

Salary: £50,184 to £55,760 per annum plus benefits

Position Type: Permanent, Full-Time

Benefits: Excellent contributory pension scheme, generous paid holidays, 35-hour (for full-time staff) working week, learning and career development, subsidised staff restaurant (Cambridge office), staff sports and social club, free private healthcare plan, income protection scheme, critical illness insurance, life assurance, free on-site parking (Cambridge office), season ticket, car/motor cycle and cycle to work schemes, membership subscription, employee assistance programme, eye-care at work scheme, wellness initiatives, flexible work environment, employee recognition, long service awards, membership subscription to professional body and RSC, two discounted staff flats on-site (Cambridge office) and more.

Closing Date: 31 January 2021

About the Role:

The Royal Society of Chemistry (RSC) seeks a Data Scientist to join us on a permanent full-time (35-hour week) basis. You can be based at either our Cambridge office, or home-based within the UK if suitable, in line with Covid-19 guidance.

The Royal Society of Chemistry's Data Science team plays an important role in our mission to shape the future of the chemical sciences – for the benefit of science and humanity. The team use their knowledge to help produce reports on topics such as inclusion and diversity in the chemical sciences, to help prepare briefs to guide government policy on research funding and education, and to take part in international competitions to improve the state of the art in machine learning. They focus on projects that make a measurable difference.

The Data Scientist employs techniques and theories drawn from many fields within the broad areas of mathematics, statistics, and computer science. Specifically, the role includes an understanding of domain knowledge, along with corporate data to drive insights and find strategic opportunities for the Royal Society of Chemistry.

As a Data Scientist for the Royal Society of Chemistry, you will have expertise in machine learning and applied statistics, programming, and domain knowledge. The role is highly technical and hands-on and involves running projects to mine complex data sets to discover knowledge that is valuable to the business and requires a level of project management experience.

Your core responsibilities will include:

- Advise on and investigate the feasibility of data science solutions and ideas.
- Conduct hands-on machine learning and applied statistics projects.
- Collaborate with a diverse set of users and stakeholders with different levels of statistical knowledge to adapt approaches to new insights based on data findings.
- Clearly and objectively communicate results, as well as their associated uncertainties and limitations.
- Present complex findings in an intuitive and understandable manner.
- Extract meaning from data and to produce data products that convert raw data into a strategic asset, both in terms of chemical science data as well as with corporate data.

About you:

- Qualification in machine learning, natural language processing, statistics, or another numerate discipline. Higher degree required (Ph.D. preferred).
- Comprehensive expertise in data science, preferably with a science focus.
- Experience of applied statistics and machine learning.
- Experience in handling large datasets.
- Skilled in R, including the Tidyverse, Shiny and commonly used statistical modelling/analysis techniques using and/or Python, including NumPy, SciPy and Pandas.
- Skilled in database technologies such as SQL and MongoDB.
- Expertise in Cheminformatics/Chemistry data and handling large datasets desirable.
- Natural language processing and text mining highly desirable.
- Experience of different software development methodologies including Agile techniques and continuous delivery.
- Well-organised, self-motivated team player; aptitude for project management.
- Able to clearly communicate technical concepts to a non-technical audience.
- Negotiating skills to quickly resolve customer issues.
- A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques.

At the Royal Society of Chemistry, we support development and offer excellent benefits.

If you are interested in this opportunity, please apply before the end of our closing date.

You may have experience of the following: Data Analyst, Data Scientist, Support Data Analyst, Data Analysis, Technical Support Analyst, Account Manager, Account Management, Data Manager, Database Manager, Statistics, Machine Learning, etc.

Ref: 96319

About the Team The team is a diverse group of machine learning, AI, NLP and other data science experts. they work closel...
fullDescription:
We are looking for an experienced Data Scientist to join the development and modelling team of a global media agency.

The role supports the delivery of projects for an advanced platform designed to automate the delivery and optimization of video into programmatic demand side platforms.

About the Team

The team is a diverse group of machine learning, AI, NLP and other data science experts. they work closely with the core businesses to conceive and produce innovative data applications, creating value for the group and potentially disrupting current processes and business models.

About the Role

Working in a highly collaborative (for now virtual environment), you will support the core team to build and deliver client engagement for the first client projects following the POC trials. You will need to be entrepreneurial, pro-active and able to work with the lead engineer and team to build the project, spot and raise any issues and work with the team to resolve.

Responsibilities

  • Focus on delivery and optimization of the projects on Facebook and Google’s DV360.
  • Report and present findings and developments including results clearly and efficiently, verbally and in writing
  • Support the core development team on additional work streams.

Requirements

The successful candidate will have a broad skillset including:

  • A doctorate or equivalent experience in in Machine Learning, Computer Science, Mathematics or quantitative discipline
  • Professional experience in a data scientist or a related software engineering role
  • Competence to commission, interrogate, deploy, and assure advanced predictive analytics and machine learning models, such as Bayesian models, natural language processing and reinforcement learning
  • Comfortable mining unstructured data and ingesting data from various sources such as REST/SOAP frameworks
  • Familiarity with computer vision paradigms will be a good to have
  • Experience with popular data analytics and modelling packages.
  • Deep understanding and hands-on experience with optimization, data mining, machine learning, deep learning and natural language processing techniques
  • Experience in various types of programming (imperative, object oriented, functional and declarative)
  • Experience working in a multi-threaded & concurrent environment and with non-blocking & event-based systems
  • Have knowledge of Software Design Patterns and Enterprise Architecture Patterns
  • Have used continuous integration, version control systems and cloud based services (e.g. Windows Azure, Amazon AWS, Docker, Kubernetes)
  • An understanding of rapid application development approaches and techniques for mission critical solutions

This is a brilliant opportunity to utilise you data science skills in disrupting and innovating within an established gloabl business so be sure to apply now!

jobDescription: SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST - DV CLEARED NEW PERMANENT OPPORTUNITY AVAILABLE FOR A SENIOR DATA SCIENITST WHO HOLDS DV CLEARANCE IN CHELTENHAM  Permanent opportunity for a Senior Data ScientistDV Clearance is required for this role£32,000 to £38,500 plus bonus and benefitsCheltenham based organisation in an accessible locationSenior Data Scientist</li...
fullDescription:
SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST - DV CLEARED

NEW PERMANENT OPPORTUNITY AVAILABLE FOR A SENIOR DATA SCIENITST WHO HOLDS DV CLEARANCE IN CHELTENHAM

  • Permanent opportunity for a Senior Data Scientist
  • DV Clearance is required for this role
  • £32,000 to £38,500 plus bonus and benefits
  • Cheltenham based organisation in an accessible location
  • Senior Data Scientist
  • To apply please call or email

WHO WE ARE?

We are recruiting a permanent Senior Data Scientist to work with a leading global private defence organisation to work on a range of cloud transformation projects.

WHAT WILL THE SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST BE DOING?

As a Senior Data Scientist, you will be building out a team to help apply data science and machine learning to a range of cutting edge platforms. This an area of high growth for the business and there is a great opportunity to be a real authority and be involved in some of the biggest projects in the UK. Projects will range from R&D to large scale deployments and will include forecasting, decision trees and deep learning, amongst other new technologies.

THE SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST SHOULD HAVE….

  • Demonstratable experience developing & delivering data science strategies
  • Experience developing and growing a data science team
  • Current DV clearance
  • Any experience with machine learning, dep learning, NLP and cloud platforms would be a strong desirable
